description:
Whenever we are at the pier we have to stop by at this place!!! You can see them make the crepes from the window and it just looks so appealing!!!

It's so fresh and yummy!!! We always get the bananas, strawberries, and Nutella crepes!!!
author: Regina R.

description:
The pesto turkey with avocado and cheese was tempting from the window. I was a tourist who didn't want to spend a lot on dinner. I wanted something super simple and easy.

The workers taking orders and cutting veggies were playing around with each other and throwing out the f-bomb as if the place were empty. It took about a minute for them to come over and take my order. I stood awkwardly looking around in front of the register. 

There were 2 slices of deli turkey slices slabbed on a bed of shredded cheese with 2 chunks of avocado. The pesto was incredibly salty and had the straight-from-a-jar taste. I was nauseous the rest of the night.

I would not come back.
author: Dana M.

description:
Decided to stop here for some funnel fries .  They were tasty, a bit overpriced but still tasty.   The reason for the 1 stars is simple; customer service.   
As we waited for our order a gentleman approached the female cashier and explained that what he had ordered was simply terrible, and it was rancid!  Now, under normal circumstances, an employee would apologize and offer something else, a refund etc.  This girl laughed in this man's face, said, "really, well i like it" then turned and walked away from him, the man was shocked at what had happened and just shook his head,as if asking himself "did that just happen?"

Do yourself a favor and don't bother - it's overpriced and you get bullshit with your order.
author: Basilia C.

description: Boys wanted to see San Francisco before our flight home and they were hungry. We got here super early and nothing was really open. Stumbled upon this place and the boys wanted to try it. The boys really enjoyed their crepes but I thought mine was okay. I ordered the turkey, ham, cheese, and pesto crepe. I enjoyed the funnel fries the most. Just not much of a crepe person and have not had a superb crepe. Please let me know if you have a place in mind where the crepes are phenomenal, I'd love to try it and change my mind. Cute little shop. Definitely check it out.
author: Souzana V.

description:
So this place is not all bad, I've had the banana Nutella crepe which was extremely good. It was very sweet, so I felt full, but I enjoyed. I've also had a crab meat crepe with avocado, spinach, and mozzarella cheese as well as other ingredients; it was light, and hearty, good for a mid day meal. I've had better crepes, since most are not located in the middle of pier 39, other restaurants have to be better. Hence the three star, it's neither the best nor the worst, I do recommend giving it a try at least once. 
Au revior
author: Santiago E.

description:
They serve Starbucks coffee. Although I didn't get a crepe, my friend did. He said it was pretty good but nothing too special. The staff seemed to be doing their own thing and were either tired, maybe high, or just irritated. Not sure but regardless, nobody is going here cuz they want the best crepe in the world. Cute shop on the pier with many other coffee and great places along the walk.

If in SF, come walk the pier. Get some chowder
author: Rachrelle R.

description:
Here is the short of it.  The cost for a crepe is between $7-$11.  The banana and whipped cream is $6.50. The seasonal fruit is $9.50.  The difference?  Seasonal fruit has a few strawberries.  This experience is a good understanding of the overpriced nature of the shop.  Oh, and the crepe is way too thick and folded like a burrito.  

What did I learn today?  It is better to go hungry than have a creperia steal your money.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Pretty expensive for a crepe that was just alright, I feel like I was paying more for the experience, as the ceilings were covered with mirrors and the location is right on the pier. 
The staff was still supper nice, and the crepe got to us rather quickly.
author: Gabi K.

description:
This place is soooo good. We always go here when we are at the Pier.
A must have for anyone that comes from out of town to visit.  I've tried several of them. This is the place to go if you have the munchies.
author: Angel C.

description:
The crepes we had were excellent. Thin like they should be.
We were on our honeymoon and we were hitting that place every day when we discovered it.
Prices were a bit high but that's to be expected from Pier 39.
Recommended.
author: Olga M.

description: Convenient location, parking is a hassle. Good fast customer service. I love their Nutella crepe with strawberries along with their crab crepe, very delicious
author: Helen V.

description: Pricey but standard for Fisherman's wharf.  Really good fries, but $7. Good sweet crepes and so-so savory crepes.
author: Ish A.

description: They have a variety of sweet and savory crepes. The girls strawberry for dessert and it was delicious and filling. The crepe is made fresh to order. There isn't a lot of table space for eating. Prices are what you would expect for a touristy area.
author: Jason H.

description:
Went in about 30min from closing time for a coffee. The area was clean and staff greeted me with a smile. Coffee was a typical Starbucks branded mass drip coffee, nothing amazing.
If you are looking for a quick snack or cup of coffee , for the price this place isn't bad.
author: Christopher S.

description: We got a strawberry crepe and it was delicious! I added Nutella to it. A couple from India came and sat by us and we chatted for awhile. The tables are small but it's tucked away and keeps you warm which is one reason the couple from India joined our table. The price was $10.25 for my crepe. Not bad priced and tasted great. My boyfriend isn't big into sweets but he liked it too!
author: Bryana W.

description: I did not get my food! I ordered the clam chowder bread bowl (which does not take long to prep), and the order took 15 minutes. I had to ask them twice about my order and after the 2nd time, they rushed to start prepping my order. The management of the business needs to be improved.
author: Silas A.

description: Best Crepes in the area! Only bad thing is the line. Always a must when playing tourist.
author: Teresa Q.

description: There are so many options to eat at pier 39 and I wanted to try all of them. I had been eyeing this place to try and finally I did. I was craving for savory after eating a lot of donuts, so ordered a veggie crepe. It doesn't take them much time to prepare crepes, they are pretty fast. Anyways, i liked my crepe. I so much wanted an egg on it but they were out of eggs. But it tasted decent, although it did need an egg as all the filling was falling apart. Next time, I would try their sweet crepe.
author: Ruchi S.

description: The food was terrible nothing like the pictures we ordered chicken crepe in the picture the chicken was grilled what we got was just small cubes of chicken with lots of tomatoes, onions and spinach. The taste there isn't at all we got sodas cause we got meals they were out of sodas and we had to wait and ask someone till we got an answer. The coffee is even worse had to throw it away with the food and on top of this we all got sick after we ate. And on top of all it's overpriced not worth a penny
author: Helen N.

description: The crepe we had was strawberry and while it was very good it was 10$. I can see if it was loaded with meat and cheese but it simply had some berries and whip cream. I guess the location increases the price.
author: Francine B.

description: This small crepe shop is very delicious. They make their crepes made-to-order. They have nice hot coffee and the shop staff are very polite. They really like making next time.
author: Michelle H.

description: Had the Banana and Nutella crepe, and the fries. It was good but not great and certainly doesn't warrant waiting 30 minutes in the queue. It's cool to be able to watch how they make the food from the side windows.
author: Vinoth C.

description: We stayed at the Marriott near the Wharf and found this place. Out of the five days we were here, 2 days we had brunch here. One day we went with a sweet crepe and the other a meat crepe. All dishes were great! No complaints even from people who are usually quite picky about crepes.
author: Alexandra K.

description: Pretty simple. Ordered a banana Nutella crepe. Got a banana Nutella crepe. Had powdered sugar and whipped cream with it. Pretty ordinary, pretty average. Crepe was a little hard. So touristy that they'll get customers no matter what.
author: Jacob D.

description: They make the crapes fresh in front of you and it's really visually satisfying and then you get the crêpe and it's delicious just a nice experience very tasty:) Big chunks of thick cut fresh nomnomnom !
author: Kathryn F.

description:
The guy that makes these crepes is the master! Seriously, my crepe was perfectly made. I loved that it was a little crispy and had a generous amount of Nutella and fruit.

Just try walking past the big windows showcasing the guy make 4 crepes at a time... you can't! Great way to bring in business I tell ya!
author: Jeanee V.

description:
I had passed by the previous night and couldn't get the thought out of mind. After a subpar dinner I thought this might be exactly what I needed to rescue the night. I wasn't disappointed. 

There was a very short wait to order and service was prompt and attentive. I chose  the s'mores crepe and hot chocolate. It was very good. Not the best I ever had but that's in another review. 

The crepe was lite and tasty; the graham cracker, marshmallow, and chocolate perfect. Whip cream and a dusting of sugar completed the treat. 

The hot chocolate didn't appear to be from a mix and the temperature was fitting for the weather. It didn't scald my throat or burn my tongue. A plus in my book since I dislike very hot drinks. Perfect for child maybe not so much for a coffee drinker. 

There is one small table to sit  within the store and another two tables outside in addition to benches nearby. I was trying to stay out of the wind and enjoy my dessert at the same time. 

Bonus- outside you can watch the crepes being made. You can see exactly what is being put inside them.  What you see is what you get.
author: Julie N.

description:
Honestly not worth it. 
$9.25 Smores crepe - chocolate chips, mini marshmallows and crushed graham crackers, topped with powder sugar and whipping cream.

They made it very quickly and you are able to watch them make it. The price tag for something so simple and not really meeting the smores taste factor, makes it 2 stars.

Love,

Canadian Tourist
author: Sally W.

description:
The fact that the cafe is on Pier 39 makes it worth the 5 stars. Pier 39 has a lovely aura and charisma which makes me fall in love with this place over and over again. Never get enough of this place. Have been coming to pier since couple of years now but somehow never tried the crepes. Always used to wonder that this place is so crowded. Now I know why!

There are so many assortments to choose from that I got confused and ordered Ghiradelli Milk Chocolate Crepe instead of the Mixed Fruit one but this was beyond delicious! Garlic fries were good too but wish they were thin cuts. It is fun to watch these guys prepare crepes right in front of you. It is an art!!

I would love to try everything on their menu ha ha :D
Will come back to try other ones too!
author: Harshada K.

description: Typical pier type food fare, quick and simple service. You them making your order in the front window. A tourist trap but good crepes, u gotta try atleast once.
author: Varsenig K.

description: Very casual and busy.  My daughter and her friend ate crepes and fries, I just tasted theirs.  I didn't think it had much atmosphere, looks much like a McDonald's.  And finding bathrooms took forever.  Seemed a bit chaotic to me but I guess it would be in such a touristy area.  It was fine, but not memorable.
author: AM W.

description: Yes yes there is huge crowd, you can see the guy making fresh crepes BUT don't fall for this trap. The crepe was so bad, had to throw it after just two bites. Sad, but yes it's one of those 'famous useless touristy thing'.
author: Garima K.

description: This is your typical street food by the pier, served on a plastic plate, so don't expect anything too fancy. It is however very satisfying and rich and will probably do a number on your waistline, haha. I ordered the Ghirardelli dark chocolate crepe and was in heaven. I loved that you can look through the outside window and watch as your crepe is being made. The perfect place to indulge after all that walking on the pier.
author: Alex N.

description:
Walking on the pier your will encounter many aromas, and we got stopped by that of the crepe café.  

They have a nice selection of savory and sweet options, see my pictures.  They also challenge your stomach by having a large window whereby you can watch them creating the crepe.

We got the strawberry Nutella creme for $8.95 +$1 for each additional topping, which included caramel.  The crepe texture was slightly crunchy which was unexpected, it was good, but not to die for.
author: Chris G.

description: I've always loved this place for dessert! I get the banana Nutella but they have plenty of other dessert crepes on their menu! Even lunch crepes if you're not feeling something sweet. The hard part is getting a table as they only have one inside and two outside, and they are 99% always in use. So I've learned to eat and walk! Lol the kids love to watch them make the crepes outside their front window. Even if there's a long line, they're fast and efficient so you won't be waiting for your order long.
author: Alexandra G.

description: I like Crepes! That's why we stopped. However, the line was out the door and we waited almost an hour to get through it all and get our food. It was good though. If you are on the wharf because your playing tourist, this is great. If you live the city, or even the bay area, why are you looking here? Do you really want to wait in the lines?
author: Andrew M.

description: My wife and I always love eating here when we stay in the city. Staff here is always friendly even when they're busy. Always delicious. Had to leave one star off due to the coffee being almost empty and not very hot.
author: Michael S.

description: This place has a simple menu which I liked. The s'more one was a little too much for me but if you're a chocolate lover you will love it. Nutella with bananas and strawberry were super good. There's is a big window in front of the crepe makers and people will stand to see the cook in action which makes it fun. Service was great.
author: Ari Y.

description: The pesto crepe was amazing. Pesto and cheese on a crepe tasted really good. It could have used more toppings
author: Rakshit M.

description: A nice small cafe to enjoy your favorite crepe fillings with a cup of coffee while watching people walking on the pier.
author: Mo M.

description:
I suggest the speciality crepes instead of the sweet crepes. The sweet crepes are overloaded with chocolate that the crepe tastes like straight sugar. 
Also the mixed fruit crepe is strawberry crepe with bananas. The speciality crepe is quite expensive but it will definitely fill you up! The reason why it is a three star is because There are fliers everywhere in their tables that make it impossible to eat without have flies on your crepe.
author: Jacky L.

description: We love this place but tonight we made a special trip out and they decided to close earlier than 9pm. How does a business make random hours?
author: Lanette M.

description: Nestled in hear of Pier 39 is the crepe cafe.  Yes it is pricy.  Yes, it will cost you arm and a leg if you purchase 4 crepes with drinks + soda.  But at the end, it's worth it.  Like other yelpers, they have various crepe combinations.  Do you want chocolate with strawberry on your crepe, OK or do you want whip cream with drizzle of honey, OK.  Here, your imagination is your guide as they will make your crepe of your dreams.
author: Izzy H.

description: Crepe and garlic fries for $15.50. We ordered the Dulce de Leche crepe. It's a sweet desert crepe. It was really good, but I thought slightly over priced. I personally wouldn't order the garlic fries again, too much oil. The service was good, the employees were nice, quick and it is pretty cool that you can see them making your order from the front window! :)
author: Angie A.

description:
At Pier 39, this crepe house got our attention thanks to their cute building and the employees cooking the crepes right behind the big glass windows. 

We got here about 8.30 AM on Saturday morning and found out that they open at 9 so paid a visit to sea lions, great time to see them since not many people around.

We got back and were the first ones to order :) Got the Turkey and ham&cheese to start and a banana&nutella one to finish our breakfast. They serve Starbuck's coffee. Portions are okay but Pier prices are a bit higher than what it really worths of course. Touristy and one-time customers usually. Not many seats out and there were a lot of flies out in between 2 benches they have to the left exit. For a quick breakfast, you can visit.
author: Ceren A.

description: The strawberry crepe with a little bit of milk chocolate is delicious!! Important tip: It's important to say "a LITTLE BIT of milk chocolate".   I may go back for seconds!
author: Lindsey S.

description: So worth it! My boyfriend and i went here for a date , we've always seen the restaurant on instagram . i was so happy to finally find the place! We ordered a strawberry crepe with nutella. It was so delicious, not only that but the customer service was on point and quick.  Totally a must go to. I fell in love .
author: Lile M.

description: These crepes are really good, they have many options for you to choose, the turkey pesto was excellent, also tried the Nutella crepe, it was good. I think it's kind of expensive but they are located at the pier 39 so everything there is kind of pricey. Either way the food was good.
author: Jonnathan J.

description: Two stars only because the employees were nice. The crab melt was cold and watery and so was my clam chowder in my bread bowl, which was more like vegetable soup. I wanted that and she wanted a crepe. It was ok... We passed tons of options but it seemed like a sign. Terrible choice. Don't waste you're time
author: Tarah B.

description: I had a huge Crepe craving this day. As I was initially on the way to another establishment I came across this gem. They have the crepes being made in the window which sucked me in. The line was pretty long, but surprisingly moved pretty fast. I had time to map out and get the perfect additions to the all time greatest crepe to satisfy my craving. I made it up to the front and ordered the strawberry and Ghirardelli chocolate filled crepe with whipped cream. As soon as I was done paying my crepe was ready to go! instant! (probably wont happen all the time, but it worked out that way) Took my first bite and was hooked. Strongly recommend coming here. I struggled to finish the portion that I was blessed with. Will be coming back!
author: Jenn R.

description:
I had the banana crepe my mother had the lemon crepe. 

In general in terms of the actual Crepe it seems a little be doughy as if its not cooked long enough on the crepe table (or whatever that thing is called that makes making crepes ez as pie).

Banana: I wish there was maybe some sort of creme or something inside. I mean it was literally a Crepe with banana slices in it. Nothing to really make it stand out.

Lemon: It a crepe with sugar in the middle folded over with a squeeze of lemon over it. it was good but nothing special. 

Overall it was ok but I dont think if i were in the area again i would stop by.
author: Melody B.

description:
Walking through Pier 39, my head turned a few times following what looked like soft, doughy crepes.

They have a nice selection of savory and sweet ones and you see them making them behind a large glass window.

We got the Banana Nutella one for $8.95 +$1 for each additional topping. We added strawberries.

Crepe was crunchy which was unexpected.

Not bad, but not amazing either for the price.
author: Silvia G.

description: It was pretty tasty.  Limited seating indoors.  Lots of birds roaming around and tables not so clean outside.  It was a fun treat.
author: Bethany M.

description: If you want quality crepe, this is NOT the place to get it. We ate here on Dec 26, ordered the mixed fruits banana and strawberry crepe for $9.75 which will be over $10 with tax and it's very dry. It does NOT have nutella and no ice cream either.  The most expensive and most bland, dried crepe I've ever had. Will never eat here again.
author: Cel S.

description:
An incredibly busy shop on pier 39 that serves mostly crepes (sweet and savory) but also a few other items as well.

The seemed ridiculously understaffed as your crepe waits (and gets cold) while the cashier finishes ringing up other orders.

We wanted a s'mores, but they were "out" of them so we settled for a Nutella one.  It wasn't the best I've had, but it wasn't the worst either.  My latte was served extra hot, just as ordered.  

You can't beat sitting by the water, taking in the views and people watching even though it's not super yummy.
author: Lucky S.

description: Tasty if not on diet. Parking in Fishermen's Wharf area, roughly $35 parking for day. Interesting just watching them make crepes. Maybe good place to take your visitors here at Pier 39 for snack after looking at seals and other shops.
author: Clifford W.

description: Pretty good place to stop in if your by the Pier/ Wharf for food. There wasn't a long line when I went and the food came out pretty quickly. There wasn't that much seating inside or outside, so fighting for a spot is likely. The clam chowder in the bread bowl was pretty good and not too rich. The chicken crepe was a little dry, but pretty decent otherwise. The crab crepe was rich and well  balanced with the avocado.
author: Angela D.

description: We had the Smores Crepe and the Funnel fries.  Bit pricey as it's a tourist location and they know they can get away with it, but the Crepe and fries were over the top good.
author: Wende G.

description: This was a great lunch restaurant! Very casual and great location near other shops and cafes. I had the turkey pesto and it was amazing!!!
author: Nicole C.

description: Y'all should go here just to see the dude with the sweet mullet. Crepes aren't bad either.
author: Sirena P.

description: Came here cause I was craving a strawberry crepe just to find myself with a bunch of uncooked dough. I tried eating half of it but I couldn't so I went to the cashier (who was nice by the way) to tell him about my situation. He told me very politely he could not refund or give me another one cause I had already eaten a portion of it which I was fine with but I will not be coming back here. I also paid for extra nutella which only had just a tiny spread. Can't believe they charge $10 dlls for this crap.
author: Charly G.

description: This place is new but they have another location on 333 Jefferson that is the one that I went to eat at last week. I had a strawberry Nutella crepe and it was THE BOMB. They made it really fast and it was super good. I will include a photo but I'm typing on my computer and I will have to send it to myself. Anyway, I digress, this place is super cute and everything is new and pretty. It has a super cute 1950s vibe and there is plenty of seating. The cabinets are this super cute blue that I actually saw something similar on that show with the Moussad's on HGTV. I don't even really like crepes and this one was so good. Anyway go, it is really good.
author: Taylor B.

description: We had four crepes and garlic fries. The fries were the worst. Way too much oil and garlic, soggy, didn't eat them. The dulce de ledge crepe was not good, the breakfast crepe was just egg and cheese. The mixed fruit and pesto crepes were decent. I'm sure there are better places near here.
author: Brad M.

description: Inexpensive, delicious, and a variety of crepes. The banana Nutella crepe does not disappoint!
author: Colleen S.

description: Possibly the best crepes I have ever had. Consistency was amazing, service was excellent and the flavors melted together to create something that probably mimicks heaven. A little pricey, but worth every bit for every bite.
author: Lizzy G.

description: Fabulous place to go, it was a true treat after our big meal. Place looks clean cashier was helpful, there was sitting available inside and outside as well. Price was fair. Overall in my opinion the place deserve a five all the way.
author: Joel P.

description: Service was nice,the food Wasn't great at all !!!.Next time I visit San Francisco I will not be eating there
author: Myrtle F.

description: The location is very convenient for tourists to grab a sweet or savory snack. I ordered a turkey pesto crepe for $10. I was not disappointed at all as it was delicious and warm. There was some yummy avocado included as well. It may be a little expensive but I think it was worth it!
author: Nasrin R.

description:
This place is great for crepes. I tasted both the lunch/dinner crepe and dessert crepes. I personally feel the dessert crepes are a little overpriced. The filling is very less. Need more fruits. But they are delicious! 

Would recommend this place if you are at pier 39
author: Swathi J.

description:
Got a drink flat no co2 what so ever completely syrup when I tell front desk she just said ok and didn't give no respond to I'll trade or get more co3. Then got the fries not cooked fully, soggy  and no garlic on the fries completely disaster   
DONT COME HERE EVER!!!!!!
author: Rich M.

description: The crepes were over cooked. Tasted more like a tortilla and the filling left much to be desired. Would not come here again.
author: G-reg S.

description: Wow, unbelievable quality and delicious , highly recommended, expensive but you have to try, don't miss it
author: Samin S.

description: Pretty good crepes that make for a delightful treat on the pier! Ginormous crepes that are for a good price, and coffee that is just okay to follow. We got a nice big s'mores crepe that came out on plastic plate and got the job done. The powdered sugar was a nice touch, and we finished it off real quick. Good snack to have when taking a seat and enjoying the atmosphere.
author: Thuan T.

description: I love crepes so when I saw this I had to get one. The crepes do taste good and the ingridients seem fresh. I had the Nutella crepe and it was good. If I would drop it down to 3 stars it would be because they are expensive. They should not cost what they do but since it is in a tourist area in San Fran prices are higher I assume.
author: Jesse V.

description: The food was good but the service was below par.  They forgot my order of garlic fries and I waited about 15 minutes only to be told that they forgot about my order.
author: Dorothy C.

description: I got the Nutella and bananas crepe ... wow it was good ! Another must try before you leave pier 39. The employees are kind and hardworking . You can watch the cooks make the lovely crepes from the window . They are super clean and use Fresh ingredients from what I could see . And you can see it all with the open kitchen and outside view .
author: Jamie T.

description: Finally got to try this place out for a snack before catching a plane back to the east coast. Really good crepes and made fresh! The price is a bit steep but you're in a tourist area so that is expected.  We split a Banana Nutella crepe and it was delicious!
author: Kyle B.

description:
Crepe Cafe was alright, gets the job done. Popped in for a bite and wanting something savory, I shared a ham and cheese crepe with a friend. I wanted to order a breakfast crepe but I guess they don't serve past breakfast time since they didn't have any more eggs left :(. The crepe wasn't bad, but definitely was expensive for what it is as it is located on Pier 39. We also ordered garlic fries, which were on the oilier side but had plenty of garlic. Unfortunately it felt a bit too heavy with the addition of rather cheap cheese sprinkled on top, but it still hit the spot.

Just a place to stop by while walking around on the pier, and one of the better choices for a quick bite. Seating is very minimal, so expect to eat on the go especially during peak times.
author: Jessica L.

description: Best place for crepes. Made fresh and best part you get to watch them make it! Really crowded space tho.
author: Jazmyne N.

description: It was not busy at all but they still took long to take my order. I ordered the crab crepe which I was totally dissatisfied. I spent $20 and didn't even like it. Definitely not what I was expecting and will not be going back
author: Visha V.

description:
This is a hidden gem among the more touristy spots in Pier 39. They make delicious sweet and savory crepe combinations right before your eyes, at a reasonable price. If you don't want to eat at a watered down burger joint with a 'fun' sounding name, then I would recommend you check this place out. 

I decided on their Florentine crepe combo, which comes with French fries and a drink. I know, crepes and fries sounds weird, but it works for this place pretty well. And believe me, their fries are delicious! The crepe was savory, with cheddar and feta cheeses, spinach, and onions. My only suggestion would be to sauté the spinach, because it was just fresh spinach thrown on the crepe- not that I'm complaining, because trust me it was delicious, but I think it would be even better with sautéed spinach. 

The fries were cooked fresh, and were hot, crispy in the outside and soft on the inside. Or in other words, perfect. A great addition to my delicious crepe. 

If you find yourself drawn to the touristy Pier 39 but want a delicious meal, to yourself a favor and eat here. You won't regret it.
author: Melinda R.

description:
Not the best and not the worst crepe I've had but as the namesake of this cafe - I was hoping it would be better. Being smack dab in the middle of touristville - I figured that the usual comes into play - average food at high prices and this place is no different.

Their window display of crepes being made is probably the best marketing tool and what's driving their business. The ingredients are fresh - but the crepe batter was overcooked and dry. I tried the banana and nutella crepe - the bananas were fresh and you can't possibly mess up nutella - but the crepe wrap was super dry and overcooked - I couldn't even cut a piece off with a knife. At almost $10 - I expected a bit more.
author: Brenda L.

description:
1. Expensive (~$9) but wonderful Nutella, banana, and strawberry crepe
2. Good garlic fries
author: Samuel E.

description: This place is great! The line was a bit long but it was worth it. Took longer to wait in line than to actually get the crepe. Would recommend banana, strawberry & Nutella.
author: Javier M.

description: Excellent crepes and a good value for the money.  Ordered the Hawaiian, ham and cheese, banana with strawberries and chocolate.  Kids loved watching the crepes made in window.  Nice to have Starbucks serviced onsite.  Seating is limited.
author: Terry P.

description: Great good but gets packed quickly and they get it in weeds. None-the-less, we eat there every time especially when we have a big group.
author: Cecilia S.

description: I would give this place a 5 but I'm biased because I love crepes. To my bf, it was just a crepe so yeah. The banana Nutella is my fave! Great combo! Soft and warm and delicious! Nuff said!
author: Lily V.

description: Place is packed day and night.  Service is kind of slow so expect to wait.  Crepes are average at best.  But on a cold day it tastes better
author: Bart D.

description:
This place has changed since the last few years.. I normally get banana and strawberry with nutella but it's not on the menu anymore. So to fulfill thy cravings, we added strawberries and powdered sugar to an order of banana Nutella. With that said, it came out to a special pier 39 whopping price of $12.

Really disappointed with this visit because I asked for my order to be extra crispy and I think it got lost in translation somewhere between strawberries and bananas. Just sadskis....
author: Jasmine B.

description:
While visiting the pier I noticed this place. It looked real good.

We made a point of stopping here before we left. It was as good as it looks.

YUMMY!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Mark B.

description: Went to this place; I think my expectation for crepes is totally jacked up from my crepe experience in Asia. I had phenomenal crepes in China and Japan. This crepe was too simple! It was just Nutella and banana....which is a fantastic combo...but not worth $10...common now! Bad value for money in my honest opinion.
author: Arlene G.

description:
Stopped by this place because there wasn't anything else that interested me or the other restaurants weren't open yet. I got the veggie crepe and I liked it pretty well. I didn't pay attention that it had sprouts and I hated that part. I got to watch the guy make my food which was pretty cool, most places don't let you see how your food is made. 

The reason they got 3 stars is because the crepe wasn't as good as a crepe made by a Frenchman, those are GREAT Crepes.
author: Aakash S.

description:
Great crepes in a fantastic location.

The bonus here is that you actually watch your crepes being made in the front window display.

The only problem is very limited seating, but that is a small sacrifice for such goodness.
author: Bill S.

description:
Something fun

All the crepes are cooked in an area that all can watch.  Excellent marketing strategy.  Got us to buy them.  My daughter had to have a s'mores crepe.  I got a Hawaiian, with pineapple, ham and cheese.  My daughter loved hers, mine was just ok. Would probably do it again.
author: Daryl C.

description: I like fries very much. The fries here is very tardy. I ordered fries with honey mustard and  banana Nutella crepe. The crepe is delicious too.
author: Melissa L.

description: This place had speedy service. We just got the garlic fries but they were very flavorful. Warning: if you are on a date you might want to opt out of the garlic fries. They are extremely garlicy, but still yummy
author: Dayna P.

description:
I have to admit, I did not try their crepes.  I was going to but when I saw the price, I didn't want to buy any until I saw how they make it.  The crepe making station were locate at the front of the store behind a big glass window.  At first, it looked like the guy knew what he was doing.  Then I noticed that the crepes were bubbling on the iron which is a good indication that the iron was TOO HOT.  

When he flipped the crepe over, the color looked like crap.  It was NOT appetizing at all.  I could tell by looking at it that the crepe was too dry and not soft.  At the end, he folded the crepe to put on a plate, the crepe actually cracked and part of it broke off.  I can't believe that people are so stupid that they would pay $9 for this kind of low quality crepes.

It is obviously to me that this place does not care about making quality crepes.  They just want to pump them out to the gullible tourists and take their money.
author: S L.

description:
I ordered the nutella and banana crepe, and it was delicious.  They didn't skimp on either of the ingredients as well, so it was pretty stuffed.

It's just hard to find a place to sit down and eat because it's a high tourist area.  But if you happen to be at Pier 39 and want something sweet at a decent price, you should stop here.
author: Vira P.

description:
We came here on a Monday evening and ordered the Ghirardelli chocolate crepe for $8.16. 

- You're in SF. You have to get Ghirardelli chocolate! It's super chocolaty! 
-Captivating! They make it in front of you so you have to stop and stare. and eat! 
- Not the best tasting crepe, but good dessert while on the Pier. 
- Very thick but not crispy 
- Comes with whip creme.
- It's cold. The melted chocolate soon hardened. Eat fast!
- Dirty seating. 
- If you got the coupon book from the Welcome Center, enjoy a Free large drink with purchase of a crepe! I DID :)
author: Chris C.

description:
Being all touristy doesn't mean you have to snack on popcorn and ice cream (though if that's what you're craving, go for it). Sometimes you need something just a little bit different to tide you over until dinner.

This place makes crepes fresh before your eyes (and even makes a show of it, because people crowd around the windows to both drool and watch their creations). 

My favorite was the Nutella crepe with bananas. I shared one with my friend and we satisfied our sweet tooth and hunger.
author: Janet V.

description:
Oh man.. I was in San Fran for about a week and I went to this place 3 times!... And I had the Ghirardelli chocolate crepe every single time.. with whipped cream of course! 

I love the Crepe Cafe. The staff are nice, it's got a nice selection of savoury and dessert crepes + the prices are not too bad. 

My crepe got too me quite quickly on all occasions and they were all very nice everytime. The only letdown really is the lack of seating although it's not that big of a deal really.

The Crepe Cafe is one of the places I miss now that I'm back in Melbourne... I'll definitely return someday..
author: Kevin S.

description:
Funnel Fries where a hit! Would give five stars for that alone.

The crepes are just average
author: Allen C.

description: Dont know what is better....the crepe or the wonderful smells and watching it being made outside through the window
author: Stuart K.

description: This place is amazing! They are super friendly, have speedy service and have the best crepes I've ever had. Can't wait to go back!
author: Lori P.

description: Horrible horrible service!!! We walked around 8 and a few people were still eating and waiting for their orders we waited a few minutes at the cash register and then approached one of the employees behind the counter who was handing out the orders and asked if we could order; he stated he wasn't working the cash register and pointed to gentleman that was coming out of the bathroom. He sighed when he saw us and asked to take our order I asked him a few questions about my dairy/ lactose free options . He seemed very irritated and sighed a couple times before vaguely answering me and taking our order. When he reviewed our order it was off. We tried to correct the order and annoyed he answer ,"I'm going to have to start all over in a very rude tone ". We ordered and our order arrived our garlic fries were stale and cold with the toppings just thrown on top but we didn't say anything because he didn't seem to fussy. My order which was a shrimp crepe I specifically asked an item with no mayo or cheese or any sort of dairy had a cream base . I decided to point out that we had discussed he answered angrily ,"what do you want me to do?" Taken back we ordered a chicken sandwich which came back cold not even properly heated. We didn't bother saying anything. When another customer walked in he got up banged the counter and stated he was eating and attended the customer. Very disappointed in this treatment. My cold sandwich was $12 very overpriced for cold tasteless food, bad service and rude customer service . Very disappointing .
author: Diana C.

description: Amazing crepes that stand up to the best in Rome, Italy. We loved the banana nutella.
author: Shannon C.

description:
First time trying this place for crepes! Went here with the boyfriend and some friends since I was craving something sweet. I ordered the Jammin' crepe, which was a crepe filled with raspberry jam. I also asked to replace the sour cream with extra whip cream and they sprinkled some powdered sugar on top. I believe the crepe was about $6-7. Not too badly priced! It really hit the spot after having dinner. 

Most of their crepes range around $6-9, which is pretty standard. It was extremely busy the last time we went, which was a Friday night. There are a lot of other crepe flavors I still wanted to try as well. All in all, I would come back here if I were ever craving crepes and was in the area again!
author: Jenny V.

description: Tourist trap! Overpriced and not good. Crepes are way to thick and crunchy. That's not how a crepe should be. Service is not friendly at all. $17 for two crepes... way to expensive!
author: David I.

description:
Excellent sweet tooth satisfier spot on the Pier. After a recent failed attempt at making my own crepes, I now have a true appreciation of the great skill and passion that goes into the art of crepe making. I watched the crepe craftsmanship through the display window with a mixture of envy and excitement. No sticky stubborn batter, no bubbly explosions and no defiant messy chocolate, just perfectly consistent thick batter with a golden-brown finish and perfectly layered fillings and toppings. I have decided to leave my crepe cooking  up to the professionals. 

We brought a couple of crepes (the Ghiradelli Chocolate and Strawberries Crepe the and Nutella and Strawberries Crepe) to enjoy back at the hotel room. Sadly, after a full day of rich food my stomach became really upset (Cowgirl Creamery grilled cheese sandwiches, Codmother fish 'n chips, Peet's caramel blended iced coffee, an empanada from Tanguito's and a couple of oysters from the Fish Market). 

I took one bite because I didn't want to waste it. It was so delicious that I ended up eating about 3/4 of it and calling it a night (man, being a tourist is hard!). I think I'm going to have to start carrying around a Yelp emergency pack: alka-seltzer tablets, chewing gum, notepad for food notetaking, inflatable cooler for leftovers and inflatable chairs and bottled water for unexpected long waits. 

The Crepe Cafe specializes in sweet and savory crepes. You will probably encounter a little wait (we waited about 20 minutes) but they keep the cafe very toasty warm so the wait inside isn't too bad. They have crepe meal deals for around $10 (your choice of a sweet or savory crepe, fries and a soda) and serve fresh-brewed Starbucks Coffee and specialty beverages. 

Cool stopover along the Pier!
author: Nicole D.

description: Had the Turkey Pesto crepe and the Ham and Cheese crepe. Both were very good! Biggest down side is the lack of seating/tables. We had to wait quite a bit while one of the outside tables cleared up. Only one table inside.
author: Ruth R.

description: First time here. Ordered banana Nutella, chicken crepe and garlic fries . The crepe's were good but the garlic fries not so much .
author: Dheeraj N.

description:
San Francisco is crazy about crepes, and so am I!

I've been in love with crepes since the days of yonder..I mean, the crepe cart at the student union in my college days. Lately, it seems I have only been able to savor them at special events or when I'm wandering in the Gables. However, in just two days this weekend I have been able to savor - count them 3 - in just two days.

I found this spot during my touristic wanderings through Fisherman's Wharf. Tucked away into a corner, the yummy smell was the perfect antidote to the Sea Lions. Although they have both sweet and savory crepes, I think you guys know where my attention went.

That's right, I first enjoyed a crepe with strawberry, bananas, nutella and Grand Marnier. The slight buzz from it was just enough to get me ready for my trolley ride up and down the hills during a fun afternoon of sightseeing. The crust was light, the strawberries and bananas fresh. Just the perfect amount of sugar with which to enjoy the city.

Yep, I did go for seconds! I got another one which I'm enjoying in my hotel room as I write this.
author: Sergio F.

description:
Banana crepe for $8.50. Banana Nutella crepe for $8.95. Ordered a banana crepe, asked to change to banana nutella crepe. First said it was $1.45 extra, then $1.00. When I pointed out the menu price, the professional response was "sorry I gotta pay rent."

I think this needs no explanation. A dishonest joint is a bad joint.
author: Greg S.

description:
I believe people who write reviews should not feel bad about being objective. I am visiting SF and know that pier 39 is a tourist attraction and that things are usually overpriced but even thieves have to have some honor.

I ordered the French fries yep that's it just plain French fries. The fries were okay and that is not the reason for my poor rating rather the terrible customer service and arrogance of the employees is the issue. They are busy b/c of their location and their ingenious idea of having an open widow so people can see the crepe being made.

The ketchup was suppose to be flavored...it wasn't. And then when I asked for an additional packet I was told I had to pay fifty cents just for a small packet of unflavored ketchup? Seriously???? For all the sales they generate they wanted to charge for one additional pack of ketchup. I can understand if it was a secret sauce but I was asking for only one ketchup. That is terrible.

Also the employees were too lazy to clean the tables and chairs and make it more inviting for the patrons. It is not appropriate and the owner and management should work to correct this. At least give the right amount of ketchup if your going to charge for a additional packet.
author: Ammir V.

description: The crepes here that were made today were burnt. The crepe was over cooked. I would recommend not spending your money her and getting something different.
author: Chris S.

description:
The Crepe Cafe is located mid-way into Pier 39 (probably the most crowded pier in SF). The store is a bit small with several small tables inside and outside the cafe (so, with Pier 39 being so crowded most of the time, you probably have to grab the food and go find a place to sit elsewhere). They offer both savory and sweet crepes and some other sides (such as fries).

My friend got a breakfast crepe (cheddar cheese, ham + egg) and I got their spinach, feta + cheddar cheese, onions. With soda, the total came to just $20, very affordable...especially in this touristy area. Although the place looked very inviting from the outside (there's a glass window that you can watch them making crepes from outside), I found the food to be extremely mediocre....and probably won't visit again. The crumbed eggs was pre-made and the ingredients didn't seem to be of good quality.

Looking back, I had to blame ourselves for going for crepes for lunch that day instead of seafood, which is what other restaurant establishments around this area are more known for. If you are around the area, do yourself a favor and eat seafood. There's no point eating crepes here when the crepes there weren't even that good and when the area isn't even known for crepes at all.
author: Joop V.

description: The food is honestly kind of average, maybe a little better. Great breakfast potatoes and really nice outside seating though!
author: Clay P.

description: Long line. Then when we finally got our crepe it was an over cooked crispy crepe. (Sigh) I was really looking forward to a soft tender crepe skin. I guess to deal with the long lines they crank out the crepe by using high flame. Maybe if they had 2 guys working the 4 crepe stations they could pull it off, but 1 guy doing all 4 was too long before they could get to my crepe.   Maybe you can get lucky. I wasn't.
author: Sam C.

description: Every time we come to S.F. my wife has to eat breakfast here. The crepes are pretty good but the only reason I gave it 4 stars is the fact that their menu is limited.
author: Jason L.

description: Came here on my birthday before our ferry ride to angel island. We both had breakfast crepes and they were excellent! Staff was very nice as well. Thanks!
author: California B.

description:
These crepes were the bomb! Allowing customers to watch them make the crepes is a great sight and the taste is just as great! Fries were perfect and food came out in reasonable time despite overflowing customers. 

Tables are scarce around there so we were very lucky to get the only table inside the place!
author: Alex O.

description: I can't ever write a view on the food because we didn't get a chance to eat it. The places open at 9, us and another family were there around 9:10 and it said they were still closed but the guy (who I'm pretty sure runs the place) was inside. The dad in the other family knocked and asked when they opened, the guy looked up and just blatantly ignored him and kept doing what he was doing. So we all said never mind and went over to eagle cafe just upstairs in the pier which was amazing! I would love to have tried the crepes but I refuse to give business to someone who can't even answer a simple question as to when they're open, so oh well.
author: Alexis C.

description: I had a turkey and pesto crêpe, which was amazing. However, we had an order of garlic fries, and while their texture was admirable, the taste was a little less tolerable. There was honestly simply too much garlic on them. I could see many chunks of minced garlic with each individual fry I picked up. I am surprised there isn't a oil drum of minced garlic in the store, considering how the fries tasted as if they dump cups of the stuff into each order.
author: Matt P.

description: Tried their banana and nutella crepe when I was in SF for a visit! LOVE! Look through the window while waiting for your order and watch them make your crepe!
author: Jade P.

description: Yummy Crepes. We tried the banana/nutella with added strawberry crepe and whip creme. Crepe was fresh and tasted amazing. Fast service even though crowded. Would highly recommend trying out this place.
author: Danielle R.

description:
I use to come here all the time when I worked in SF it was my favorite crepe place in the city. Went there today asked them to cook my dessert crepe a little longer to make it crispy they AGREED but they were to busy cooking them back to back since there was a line. My order was ready 1 minute after I ordered didn't even get a chance to sit down,  my crepe was no where near crispy I asked them to remake it since my Nutella crepe was falling off my fork. All I got was a lot of attitude and told they don't make them crispy even though I clearly told him that's what I wanted when ordering and he said no problem.

 He basically said well we don't make them crispy nothing I can do and was waiting for me to walk away and leave. I asked for a refund and left. All they had to do was cook it a little longer on both sides no different then cooking fries a little longer to make them crispy. It's VERY simple .... As the commercial says, even a caveman can do it!

 The crepe was a 1 and the bad customer service and attitude was -5 

My date drove me here all the way from Hayward so I could have my favorite crepeI didn't know it came with a free side of nasty attitude and bad service.
author: Felicia E.

description:
This little place was attracted to me and other tourists because it is in pier 39. My friend and I were so tired from walking a lot, so we decided to stop by this place and get French crepes. There weren't a lot of people on that day. We walked up and ordered. She had the Nutella and banana crepe. I had jammin crepe filled with raspberry cream. It was ok. Yes..their crepe was soft but I've had better. 
A little pricey since it is a tourist place. 
It took a little slow. Only two guys work there. Good choice and difference for dessert while you're in pier 39.
author: Manisa K.

description: Holy crap our crab crepe was good. My mom and I went here for breakfast and got two white mocha and shared the crepe. It was so good. Not in a very good spot, and flies everywhere around the outside tables, but good thing there's places around the pier to sit. But it's open and you can watch him make your crepe.
author: Patti R.

description:
Ugh I hate San Francisco. I had to walk up four big hills to get here. I can't believe my co worker Linda didn't tell me that there were so many hills here and that Fishermans Wharf was near the coast. What does she think I am, a map?

Anyway, I went here and it was convenient that there was a window so that you could see them make the crepes. I haven't been more uncomfortable in my life. The chef kept looking at my San Francisco Giants hat while licking his lips like he wanted to steal it. WTF. He was also eying up Linda's Rolex. What a crepe! (Pun intended)

When he poured out the batter, there was bubbles which is a no no. Back in Denver there's an amazing crepe place owned by a friendly French family. They just moved here from Paris about three years ago. They actually live in my apartment complex. Wait, never mind that's a different French family. 

When the chef flipped the crepes, it ended up looking like a tortilla. I thought I was here for crepes, not a burrito. The banana slices were inconsistent and when he folded up the crepes, it often broke. The prices were outrageous considering the poor quality of the food. At least Linda's still my friend.
author: Bob H.

description:
The Crepes here are clean and simple, you are not going to get a crazy combination of hot links and mashed potatoes with cheese. They serve your good ol fashioned fruit crepes and your everyday savory selections as well.

Price is quite good considering it is in the Wharf. Most of the time you pay a little more in this area but it makes sense though. 

Taste wise, it is also good, wont knock your socks off but you will enjoy it. This place is also a very good alternative for those times when you're hungry and you don't want to be stuck with clam chowder bowls and fried shrimp.
author: phillip w.

description: Great food. Quick service. The one thing that would make  the experience better is the customer service. Not friendly, seemed miserable to be there and rude.
author: Rozz R.

description:
Looking for a quick dessert, my fiancée and I decided to try a crepe from Crepe Cafe. We ordered a strawberry and Nutella, which set us back about $9. Flavour-wise, the crepe was delicious. 

However, the reason for the low rating was the fact that the crepe was really undercooked. Without a knife, cutting the crepe was a sticky, gooey chore. 

I'll chalk it up to the fact that the crepe prepper was super busy. He was essentially working without a break for the entire time we were walking around Pier 39 (about 3 hours). He was handling 4 crepe stations at once, and I'm sure at that point there are going to be a few crepes sent out a tad too early.
author: Vincent A.

description: The crepe I ordered was the Savory Veggie Crepe with Swiss Cheese. It was a good quality crepe, but the filling did not seem very fresh. I think the sweet Crepes may be much better based on this visit. Also, there is very little seating here, and the three or four tables outside were swarming with little flying bugs. Gnat like things that made eating very difficult. It was not a great experience.
author: Susie M.

description: Getting one star. I wish there was a option to give no stars. I have never in my life this uncomfortable. The guy passing your orders out is beyond rude and perverted. He licked his lips looking and my brest. When he looked back up at my eyes I gave him the look of wow and he loughed and walked away. I didn't say anything out loud because I was with my boyfriend or I would of told this classes boy the have respect. So with my boyfriend being there I had to keep it to my self and just deal with it. As we wait for our dish to be made this guy I seen watching me from in the inside. I looked away as soon as I seen him looking at me. While I try to stike up a conversation with my boyfriend to get him to move from the window so I don't have to be in that rude guys view. I end up being successful on getting my bf to move. But now that we moved we didn't hear our number be called. I seen a girl working and I asked her if our number been called. And with my luck she took me to the guy I was trying to avoid. He looked at my number and got mad at me for not being there to get my order. My bf end up walking in behind me and the guy became nice. We walked out and while I was walking out my napkin almost blown out of my hand since it was very very cold and windy this day. I end up becoming a  ninja and I l caught it. While I grabbed it the perverted guy was now outside beside me. At this point my bf was still walking not knowing I was not next to him because I stopped for my  napkin. And when I noticed this guy he was now right beside me licking his lips looking at my behind. He even looked me in the eyes and once again licked his lips. Let me remind you my bf is not with me at this point in time. I rushed to my bf and told him I wanted to walk and eat when really I was so tired from pretty much covering all the tourist attraction sites. But I knew there would be no way I could sit and enjoy my food. So walking and eating became a relief even if I was so tired. The other staff I can say were doing the beat they could do but he just makes this place for sure not a option the next time I ever come  here again. And that's just sad because the food was pretty good.
author: nicole G.

description:
Nutella crepe with banana, strawberry, whipped creme, and powdered sugar... Best thing I've ever had in my life.
Seriously.
author: Tam L.

description:
Warm, Fresh, and Sweet Crepes!!

I was welcomed into the pier with a whiff of fresh waffles and chocolatey aromas. Searching for a place to get some morning coffee, I was curious to check this place out. Ordered a soy mocha and it was full of creamy, chocolatey, soy goodness. 

I resisted the temptation to purchase a crepe being that my nose and eyes usually speak louder than my brain. Also, I've been to quite a few crepe places in sf and I admit I was a bit reluctant to try a crepe from the pier.. After walking around the wharf for a while, I couldn't ignore the hollering coming from within my belly, screaming for some major snackage. The voice in the back of my head whispered... you know you want one.... And so, you've guessed it.

We ordered a BANANA NUTELLA CREPE and it was surprisingly delicious! The crepe itself was perfectly warm and a little crispy- enough to be able to delicately separate each bite with my plastic butter knife. The crepe blanketed nutella and fresh banana slices in warm layers that was comforting as well as satisfying. I was blown away- somewhat by the windy sf weather, however, more by my need to put aside my doubts about this place. I admit $7 is usually pricey for this type of crepe but this cafe is a touristy location and these crepes are enticing!! Quite glad I finally tried this place after all these years =)
author: Maiden D.

description: I had a delicious s'mores crepe and really enjoyed. Fun change-up from the typical ice cream. Nice area too
author: Andrea K.

description: Really loved this place. Had the ghiradelli chocolate crepe tonight and it was just a perfect way to end the day.
author: al g.

description:
The crepes were OK...I'm not a big fan of sharing my food with 3 other people (why not order your own?).  Especially when it comes down to everyone eating off the same plate.  Maybe I would have enjoyed it a little more and given it a 4 star instead of 3 if I had my own dish (?)

We ordered the strawberry banana crepe with nutella and some whip creme to top it off.  I tasted more of the banana's than the strawberries.  Maybe a little bit of cinnamon inside the crepe would have been good and refreshing.  

They have a variety of dishes.  Crepes are sold with vegetables, ham and cheese, eggs, fruits, etc.

The service was alright, not the greatest.  We didn't know that our crepes were already made until we went inside to check on the status.  The crepes were sitting for a good minute or so.  

It's a fun watch though and it definately grabs the attention of passerby's, customer's or not.  The cook is located through a clear glass window facing the Pier.  It's amazing how he prepares the crepes and it's exciting to watch.  [Maybe for 5 mins or so...then it gets old]

Of course I'll come back, this time, with my own dish I can savor and make love to....comfortably.
author: Aman G.

description:
You can't mess up a banana nutella crepe, it's just not possible.

My friend's parents were visiting from out of town and wanted to see Pier 39 despite our continuous advice to the contrary. While dodging Midwestern kids and fanny packs we spotted The Crepe Cafe and hoped it would provide be a sanctuary amid the incessant clicking of cameras. 

We ordered a round of banana nutella crepes and for a solid 15 minutes forgot we were in the center of a carnival. They weren't anything special, but they definitely hit the spot.
author: Tom L.

description:
Pier 39 is filled with tourist attractions and it is funny that at least one of them is food related. On almost every visit to the area, you'll see folks lined up along the windows watching them make crepes. 

As a customer, everything went smoothly. They have a long list of savory and sweet items to choose from. Since I was there for breakfast, I went for the basic egg and cheese variety. Perfectly satisfactory for a grab-and-go meal.
author: Jen K.

description:
I typically avoid the tourist spots in SF, but my girlfriend and I heard that this place was actually pretty good. She had the Turkey Pesto crepe and I had the Hawaiian. 

Hers was shockingly good and I loved mine. All in all, it was good food... the other aspects of this meal of ours was not so great. 

No place to sit, incredibly high prices for what you actually get, and a less than stellar method of calling out orders. If we were in a non-tourist zone, it would have been terrible. Since it was Pier 39, however, you should expect such problems. 

I don't think I would ever go back, to be frank. Still, if you find yourself at Pier 39 for whatever God awful reason, check them out.
author: Alan S.

description: Had a Nutella with strawberries and it was one of the best I have ever had!!! Delicious beyond imagination. Great place to grab a dessert while on vacation.
author: Yasmin E.

description:
Excellent Crepes on the Pier.

Limited seating as is expected in the heart of the touristy Pier 39.

Delicious Crepes.

Ordered:
Strawberry banana nutella
Hot chocolate (made with milk and not water)
White mocha

The Crepe was excellent although its hard to get anything with nutella wrong so maybe that's a bit unfair.

The hot chocolate didn't have a lot of chocolate flavor in it so that was a bit of a disappointment but still good.  

Recommend for crepe lovers and definitely for tourists.
author: Rimi K.

description: Many years ago this use to be a great place for crepes ....very disappointed  :( crepes look so small  and the flavor not good at all anymore
author: Patty M.

description:
This was another snack pit stop while my family was shopping for souvenirs.. Well, more of a pit stop for my mom, since she loves this place!!

I got to try her $6 sugar, butter, cinnamon crepe and it was delicious and not too filling!! It's a bit pricy but at least it is good.  That is always my way of thinking...Pricey good = better be GOOD food.

The wait was a bit of a dread though, since they get an overflow of orders!!  Next time, I definitely know where to get my crepe cravings!!
author: Kathy D.

description:
Definitely a place to stop by for dessert if you're at Pier 39.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s7VsjJqJfI_67zIg6vopeQ?userid=NOKodUWSTYVUEpqBRCOfKw)

So I was sitting down and took a bite out of my Hazelnut crepe and thought man this is good. Yummy chocolate, but where was my hazelnut, I thought there should be a puree? Then my friend says, I think we have our crepe's switched . . . so took a bite out of my real Hazelnut crepe & thought this is good . . . but dang that Nutella crepe is way better! 

Nutella crepe - yum! 

Hazelnut crepe - it's okay, hazelnut spread where you can actually taste the hazelnut puree 

seating - limited, but there's also seating options right outside 

I want to come back to just to get the Nutella crepe! =)
author: Nicole S.

description: Good and fast service, great tasty good, specially I liked Banana Nutella, veggies crepe.
author: Venkata D.

description: Great crab crepe and garlic fries. A happy tourist. Please visit my blog for the full blog post.
author: Ka Ki L.

description: Couldn't resist stopping here while walking around pier 39.  The amazing aroma of fresh crepes lured us in.  We were lucky enough to grab the only table inside!  We shared the banana Nutella crepe and i must say it was an excellent choice.  The service was efficient and friendly - the crepe was freshly made - hot, filled with lots of sliced bananas, melted Nutella and finished off with whipped cream.  Splurge and enjoy!
author: Stefanie S.

description: Staff dropped something and spilt water all over my face and not even an apology extended!!! Food were not tasty at all!
author: Amy C.

description: Took my sister in law who was visiting from Texas.  We were extremely disappointed.  It was tasteless and frankly,  sad to be honest.  There's no filling. If u order strawberry...it's like getting plain strawberry on a crispy tortilla.  Nutella is like getting a layer of Nutella on a crispy tortilla. Same for the rest. What a waste of money. I'm still mad thinking about it. It's more of a creep than a crepe.
author: Von P.

description:
Let's be fair about this place. Is it any good as a crepe place?

For what it puts out, it definitely fits the money you are going to get. Not too sloppy as it was freshly made right in front of us. The place has a nice window for letting everyone see on how the staff get to make their crepes.

For me, crepes was soooo 2003 and I haven't jumped on that bandwagon since 4-5 years ago. However, whenever I decide to come to Fisherman's Wharf at Pier 39, I just can't helped myself on taking a peek at how the crepe place was doing.

Never ceased to amaze me that I would still crave for a piece of crepe whenever I stopped by. The fruit crepes may be sweet, but it's better than getting the salty ones. The salty ones tends to be bitter as it is trying to mix the ham and cheese together.

Stick with the fruit crepes of banana and strawberries, with some whip cream and Nutella chocolate. You'll be craving for more before you know it.
author: Mike L.

description:
I forget that San Francisco is so popular for Yelpers. 105 reviews for a small crepe place!?!? Anyways, this crepe cafe is located at Pier 39. It's a mostly takeout joint but has a few small tables. 

I visited Pier 39 late at night after an exhausting day of work while on business travel. Most of the shops were closed down but since I enjoyed the crepes I had in Houston so much, I decided to stop in since it was one of the only places still open for business. 

The staff was friendly and the smells of the crepes blended deliciously with the smell of the sea on a brisk evening. I ordered a sugar and butter crepe that was piping hot. They ran out of takeout cones so I just wrapped in a paper plate and napkin and headed back on my walk through Fisherman's Warf to my hotel. It's definitely a treat to eat something hot, doughy, sugary and buttery while trying to get warm in the cold air. 

Unfortunately most crepes do not compare to the crepe I had in Houston. But overall the crepe was still tasty.
author: Angel W.

description: This is my favorite crepe place! I usually get sweet crepes here, which are made fresh (you can watch them being made) and are warm and sweet. I like that I don't really notice the pancake part as much compared to crepes I've had at other places, which tend to have richer and heavier-tasting pancakes. It being in Pier 39, there are always tourists and you might have to wait a little. But I do make a point of coming here almost every time that I go to SF.
author: Sydney J.

description: Crepes are okay, but quality has gone down a little.  There was too much ham in the ham and cheese crepe.  I ordered no salt fries but still ended up with salted ones!  That's what happens when you chitchat with coworkers! And don't bother ordering the funnel fries. They were too oily and rubbery in texture.
author: Ron D.

description:
Yummy!!

Had the chocolate crepe and the veggie crepe and shared both with a couple of friends. All of us loved them!

We went here during the fleet week and the wharf was crowded, but we didn't have to wait too long, enjoyed looking at the crepes being cooked while we waited.
author: Harsha G.

description: Freakin amazing creeps I would say. A little pricy on the side but everything was fresh and delish!
author: Kathy A.

description: Got a strawberry Nutella crepe, crepe was very salty and crispy and strawberries were very squishy & a water bottle was $3!!!!!
author: Lisa D.

description:
This a cozy little crepe shop amongst the tourist filled Fisherman's Wharf. 

From what I saw, we came at a good time. Usually, there is a line out the door. Which I believe. It's such a small shop. I tried the banana & nutella crepe... it was AMAZING!! To me, anything with nutella is delicious but the crepe itself was well cooked. These gentlemen really know their crepes. The serving size was very decent. I wish I had tried their coffee but it was just too expensive for my taste buds. Three crepes and two bottles of water almost cost me $20!?!?!
author: Queen Claire B.

description:
A regular crepe place.
I got the Grand Marnier crepe with strawberries, banana and nutella. 
It was good, the grand marnier balanced the sweetness. I liked it!

The crepes ar good, nothing fancy or that delicious that you would crave for.
But I will keep coming back.
author: Parminder Nayyar C.

description:
PERFECT place to order crepes (especially if it is your first time), actually best place to order crepes! My first time eating a crepe and ever since then I have never tasted a crepe like the ones at The Crepe Café, I miss NorCal!
Service
Very friendly staff

Ambience
Tiny, quaint café, but their café is very modern with up to date utilities, and a very clean seating area and kitchen (you can see from the dinning area) area . 

Food
Their crepes are HUGE and they make it to order, right in front of you, on a flat top stove with a glass window separating the cook and the customer. They also have many ways to order your crepe and different flavors to choose from! This was the first time I ever had a crepe and this was hands down the best place I have ever had a crepe! Whip cream, chocolate, powdered sugar, fresh fruits, mmmmmmmmmm mmmm goodness gracious!


It is also on Pier 39, it can't get any better than that! Sometimes you can see the seals chillaxin' near the pier too!
author: Ha'Ane T.

description: They're supposed to close at 10 on Sundays. Got here at around 9:25 and they're already closed. The two workers saw us walk up and they just kept avoiding eye contact!
author: Elen Joie B.

description:
Came here for breakfast and left satisfied. 

I ordered the veggie crepe and added an egg. It was a nice size that filled both me & my wife in one crepe.  Very tasty and everything tasted fresh.

Wished the crepes were a little more crispy.
author: Salim G.

description:
I absolutely love love love this place. I come here every time I go to Pier 39. Their crepes are made to perfection. My favorite is the strawberry, banana, and nutella. It's the only one I get (but I've been meaning to try more)! 
There is the right amount of banana and strawberry and there is a good amount of nutella! It's well balanced. 
Each bite literally melts in your mouth. It's a must try if you're at Pier 39!
author: Marsea C.

description:
Yeah Yeah..... It's pretty amazing how the crepe maker is showing off by the glass window, making all the crepes look delectable and yummy and you get in that long line to get one. 

I'll tell you this: NOT WORTH IT.

I was a victim. I saw him smother nutella on one of his crepes as i was watching him make a crepe through the glass window. I needed nutella. I wanted nutella in my mouth. ASAP.

Boyfriend and I ordered a Banana Nutella crepe.

PRETTY LAME. 

bad bananas, really not all out as other places with their nutella...and the crepe mixture was bland. 

Not to mention. EXPENSIVE.

No tables inside the store. Coffee area was such a mess. Wait was long as only two people were working. one was handling money and serving plates of food. YUCK. Have a runner with clean hands to serve people's food please.
author: Monica H.

description:
Crepe's created to order and deliciously made. 

The service, however, was sub par. Servers didn't seem very excited to be present. 

Non the less, I'd return.
author: Chris M.

description:
...this was an amazing crepe place to eat!  We went back twice and had tried a total of 4 crepes, and each one was delicious!

Our first as the Nutella and cream.....delicious and chocolatey....we wanted a couple more bites when it was done!

We also had the ham and cheese....stuffed full of meat and very cheesey....it hit the spot!

Next day we returned and had a butter & lemon....so flavorful and tangy!

Also had sugar and cinnamon....again, sweet and nice!

 We wished we had found this place on our first walk-through of pier 39' unfortunately, it was found on our last two days in San Fran...but we made each day count!


And on a side note....they also served excellent French fries!
author: MJ S.

description: Crepes... how can I say no to crepes?? The crepes here are good and there's a good variety of them. Of course, me being me, I stick with what I like- nutella and bananas. If you get the coupon book from upstairs in the visitor center, you can get a free drink with your order. The free drink they gave us was HUGE, not some rinky dinky small free size, but almost like a big gulp size!
author: Carol N.

description:
Don't let the window display fool you! Worst crepes ever! Please save your money! 

Not only am I disgusted with the crepes themselves but also with the felicity and the customer service! The employees notably did not speak perfect English which is a bit frustrating. The cashier  called me "Sir"  more than once when I am OBVIOUSLY a woman. Never in my life have I been more insulted. Btw he said this with a big grin. When I questioned him with confusion he acted as though I had not said a thing. At this time I was becoming increasingly frustrated but I chose to let it go in fear of it causing a scene.

The crepes were tasteless as they did not add whipped cream or  powdered sugar. I ordered four different types of crepes and all were equally nauseating. The batter was far too thick. 

Considering their location is in the center of the tourist zone you would think  they would clean up a bit.  Yeah I guess not, the tables  were sticky and left with others mess. We were too uncomfortable to sit and eat so we ended up leaving. SO disappointing! Needless to say I will not be returning!
author: Heather M.

description:
Now, I do believe they can make a good crepe. The worst part of mine was the filling, so at least the crepe concept is sound. They have a nice window where you can watch their "mad skillz yo". 

I got the crab salad crepe and it was a little on the too fishy side. I ended out sharing it with a pretty chill seagull. I'm sure it then proceeded to go take a shit on an unsuspecting pier walkers head, but life goes on.

I would still give it a try for one of the sweeter crepes for sure.
author: Eric M.

description: I do not usually write review like this but I should at this time.  My friend and I ordered mixed fruit crepe which is #7 and we spitted it out at first bite. I did not expect really good crepe on pier 39, but also did not expect SO BITTER taste for dessert. We could not swallow at all. I think the cook put something wrong in ours. It was the worst choice for dessert after having fantastic crab dinner. Holy CRAB dinner and Holy CRAP Crepe.
author: Sophie J.

description: At my favorite S.F. tourist trap, Pier 39, my wife and I were drawn towards the Crepe Cafe. We noticed the crowds around the glass window looking at the guys creating crepes. I walked in and ordered the banana with nutella and paid a little extra for strawberries. Before I knew it the crepe was devoured by the kids and wife, that's how good it is.
author: Alberto E.

description:
My buddies and I were hungry in the morning, so we went scouring for a place to satisfy our hunger. We didn't have to walk for long before we stumbled upon this little cottage like cafe in the heart of a plaza near Pier 39. A couple of us had the hawaiian crepe, and one of my friends had the chicken one. The hawaiian crepe was simple enough, with cheese, ham, and pineapple, but it was delicious nonetheless. The chicken crepe was good as well, but I wasn't a big fan of the cheese. But that's just me, because I'm not a huge cheese enthusiast.

The price wasn't super cheap, but it wasn't too expensive either. It's a nice place to stop and have a quick breakfast, but it's not really a 'sit down and enjoy your breakfast' type place. It kind of has the feel of a fast food environment for some reason, I can't really put my finger on it. The food is good though, give it a shot.
author: Yong L.

description: Banana Nutella crepe... Amazing. My wife and I loved it. Fast service even when it was busy.  We got ours for breakfast, but I really want to try some of their savory ones for lunch.
author: Brandon S.

description: I am from France, and my parents from Morocco.  I know crepes and been eating them my whole life! And these crepes are some of the best outside of my country I have ever eaten! Every time I visit SF I must stop by for some crepes, Nutella and banana. mmmmmm :)
author: Steve A.

description: I had the Nutella crepes and they were FANTASTIC. My husband and daughter had the strawberry crepes which were very good as well. The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is because of the garlic fries. They were basically fries with a little bit of garlic and a HUGE glob of pesto sauce on top. I love pesto, but this was so overpowering you couldn't taste anything else. It was basically like eating pesto straight from a jar with a spoon. Definitely go, but pass on the garlic fries.
author: Ariel K.

description:
I loved this cute little crepe shop!

My friend and I shared a dark ghiradeli chocolate and fresh strawberry crepe and were completely satisfied! 

I was in heaven after the first bite! The crepe was made to perfection and the chocolate was melted in between the layers of strawberries.  This was the perfect breakfast treat before our Alcatraz tour...not something to miss!
author: Niti B.

description: Ok the crepe we had here was not bad, but I've had sooooo much better crepes for cheaper prices in other restaurants. We got the turkey pesto crepe and it was just lackluster. It had turkey ham, pesto, and avocado, and really didn't taste any better than something I would make at home. I can't speak for the dessert crepes, but if this is your first time trying a crepe, trust me that crepes are better than this.
author: Lily T.

description: Omg where to begin. Let's see, after walking up all the big hills on lombard street, I decided to go to Pier 39 to look more like a tourist.
