I saw this crepe place and was interested by the window they have that shows the actual production of crepes. Thats where I got turned off. The crepes while they were cooking had so many bubbles I thought they were going to blow up. After he folded the crepes in order to serve them, it was obvious they were harder than diamond. Yuck!
author: Beepbob S.

description:
Well, ya know.. it IS the pier but for overpriced pier food it's pretty good. :-)

The crepes are always consistently pretty darn good.. my favs are the banana and nutella or the lemon and sugar. They're always pretty generous with the fillings and the whip cream which is nice. 

Be prepared though as there is *always* a line here... not to mention a crowd watching the crepe makers. It's cool though as the line goes fast but be prepared to stand and eat your crepe as there's a total of like 2 tables and a couple benches outside. 

The crepes are on the pricey side...but like I said, it is the pier and I guess they gotta pay the rent. :-\
author: Alma P.

description:
always come down to the wharf and watch this people make crepes all day everyday !
i got banana nutella boy oh boy ! it was good and the price is okay for crepes.
people are always watching by the window. i love this place :)
its pretty messy outside, the workers are always busy.
author: R F.

description: We got the strawberry and Nutella crepe.  They put a lot of powdered sugar and whipped cream on for you.  Be careful when you walk outside with the crepe,  because it gets windy in sf. All that sugar blew onto my fiance ' face. Lol. We had no idea until I looked up and saw sugar all over her face.  Good crepe.
author: Jaydee N.

description: "Place is small for seating if it's cold be ready to seat outside. Crepe was very good."
author: Mari C.

description: Very delicious! Breakfast crepe with ham , egg, and cheese highly recommended.  They are very fast.  At night there is a line out the door but that's always a good sign!
author: Cindy F.

description: Creeps were yummy. Outdoor and indoor seating. It was a cold day, the doors were open so it was a bit cold inside. Great prices. Very friendly staff. French fries taste too greasy.
author: Paola W.

description: Good food but didn't have French fries as advertised with multiple posters in the cafe.
author: Afsheen A.

description:
Just walking past this place mkes you want to turn around to buy one! Which is exactly what I did! LOL

I got the strawberry & whip, I think it's the #7. The strawberries were super fresh and sweet! And the size of the bad boy is about the size of an 10 inch paper place, if not bigger! I usually can't finsh a whole one to myself, but this time I was! That tells you something...it was, as any californian would say, HELLA BOMB!

Paid less than $8 for my crepe...well worth the wait and the price to have scarfed one down! 

P.S. Be prepared to stand... there's not alot of seats to enjoy your crepe! I found tables near the ice cream shop...just around the corner from the place! It was the only place I could enjoy my crepe without fighting with the oversized seagulls!
author: Chelle R.

description:
Fisherman's Wharf has a decent selection of places to eat. But if you want desert, then The Crepe Cafe will do it. Their Nutella Banana Crepe is so delicious it will make your mouth water. 

They have so many choices that when it comes down to you ordering, you will not know what to order. 

This place is a must if you are at the Wharf.

Must Haves: Nutella Banana Crepe.
author: Frank O.

description:
Awesomest crepe place ever!!
First came here 3 years ago, and this place has not failed me once since then.
Its awesome to see your crepe being made from outside the shop, makes it so much yummier!!
Seating sucks.. they need to get more tables.
Fries!! Fries + non-sweet crepes == awesome combo!! Anything tastes better with fries.. glad this place has them.
author: Aditya M.

description: Delicious crepes savory or dessert type, you can't go wrong ordering from here.  I had the Florentine Crepes, it was very good, so good I ordered it twice.
author: Louie A.

description: OK crepes, mediocre fillings. Tourist prices but better than most on Pier 39.
author: Marcus T.

description:
Overpriced, just like everything else on Pier 39. But i didn't give a shit. It was my birthday and there were no other crepe places around open at 9 on a Sunday. So i settled.
total tourist attraction so i tried to avoid it, even though i'm a tourist haha.
I asked for extra extra nutella, as i always do. And they definitely didn't disappoint me :] twas yummy and overflowing with hazenut-chocolately goodness. Just how i like it. My boyfriend got a strawberry crepe. Which is literally a crepe with pieces of strawberry inside and some whipped cream on top? I found it pretty damn boring. But he said it wasn't bad. eh..not my style. I need some chocolate.
If by the time i'm done with my crepe, my boyfriend isn't laughing at how much nutella i have on my face, i know it wasn't a good crepe. And by the end of this one, my boyfriend was taking pictures and cracking up.
So. Job well done, Crepe Cafe.
author: Amanda S.

description: The crepes were really good, but they really could use more table seating opportunities. If I have to use a fork and knife, I want a table, not a paper plate in my lap sitting on a bench. It was good, but not sure I'd come back for lack of tables.
author: Lisa T.

description: Stopped by here quickly on our way our of town. I ordered my favorite--banana nutella crepe and it was DELICIOUS! My only feedback would be is that they don't offer it to go. The best crepes places wrap them by hand in wax paper for those who wish to eat on the go. No luck here, but the guy said they would be doing so shortly--
author: Sarah C.

description:
This is a fun little shop.  On a cold day there's nothing better than standing by the warm and large windows watching the crepes be made and then getting to eat them!  
Yes, they are a little dry so they're not perfect but you don't eat them plain - I love mine with nutella and strawberries and really- it's the Pier it's not gourmet it's the experience that counts so go it's fun and tastes pretty good.
author: Meg C.

description:
To compare anything on Pier 39 to a cute little Paris cafe just isn't fair, so after setting my expectations appropriately, Crepe Cafe does just fine. With my new office in Fisherman's Wharf, I've been adjusting my expectations a lot lately.

The Chicken Special with spinach, red onion, tomatoes, and jack cheese is quite tasty. They use real breast meat, not processed-chicken-food-product, and they cook the whole thing fresh just for you. (Notice that many of the Paris street vendors don't do this, they precook them. Hey, maybe we can compare!) The Crepe Cafe even offers a discount for folks that work on the wharf, so a big filling crepe with fries and a drink still comes in at $8 and change.

I've had mixed experiences with the staff. On busy summer days, they can be a little brisk, but just today we had a delightful conversation with  a guy that explained what a cordless power-drill is doing on the shelf behind the counter with the other cooking implements (hint: powerdrill + paint mixer = $40, commercial mixer = $400).

They've never messed up my order, and they get bonus points for having an Icee machine along with the regular soda fountain (white cherry and blue raspberry, thanks for asking!).

The fries are good and very fresh since they're made to order. The dipping sauces... well.... the honey mustard tasted more like corn-syrup than either honey or mustard. The ranch and the jalapeno ketchup on the other hand are both quite tasty. I'm not brave enough to try the Aioli.

Overall, a solid 4 stars.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Some friends and I were looking for some dinner while we were visiting Pier 39, and we saw The Crepe Cafe and decided to try it. 

I had the turkey crepes.....and it was DELICIOUS!!  It was huge, and I was stuffed by the time I finished it off....but I had a smile on my face :)

Would most definitely go here again! And take a few seconds to watch the guys make the crepes in the window...pretty cool stuff!
author: Jenna D.

description: I love their veggie crepes with avocado on them, it feels tasty and heavy with the cheese, avocado and sprouts. My family has relished their banana Nutella crepe which is delicious
author: Ram S.

description: Banana nutella crepe was alright. The propotion of the filling (bananas and nutella ) are also good. But nothing special really. The crepe itself is okay.. soft and fluffy.
author: Kenny W.

description:
We had a sea food crepe it was ok it tasted too fishy for me. The banana nutella was just ok too.

They need to focus on keeping tables wiped down after each guest. They're left sticky and dirty.
author: Evalyn P.

description:
I stopped by here last week after being enticed by the pictures of pomme frites in the window.  After staring at them for ten minutes from the jewelry store next door, I finally walked over to grab some to munch on.

The fries are a bit pricey, but is understandable since it's in a touristy location. The service seemed quick and the fries tasted somewhat similar to the batch you'd pick up from burger king.  

The sauces however were a bit unexpected.  I got the "jalapeno ketchup" and "mayo pesto". the ketchup tasted pretty sweet with a bit of spice to it, and the mayo actually tastes really good after a couple of times.
author: Allan G.

description:
4 stars for the FRITES alone

Originally I was going to order a crepe for dinner and frites, but my two friends ended up ordering dessert crepes instead, so I only ordered frites with pesto mayo as a snack. 

OMG, I love their frites!!!!!!!  

I ordered a small with pesto mayo and it was absolutely delightful. They were salted to perfection. They came fresh from the fryer. Crispy on the outside, hot and yummalicious on the inside.  I am a fan!

Writing this review so I'll remember to hit up their frites next time I'm at Pier 39.
author: Dawn D.

description:
Mmmm... I've always been a fan of crepes, but didn't realize how popular they were in San Francisco. Almost everywhere I went there was a crepe spot. 

I tried The Crepe Cafe's gnutella and banana crepe for a midday snack and it was fabulous. There is seating outside, so you can chill out and listen to the sounds of the bay water and chatty tourists.
author: Julie A.

description:
I got a crepe with strawberries. I wish I would have pay more attention to how they were making them. Thats my fault. I thought the crepe would have the strawberries on top, but instead they were inside the crepe. I didn't like that, because it heated up the strawberries and made them taste sour. :( If I come back Ill ask for the strawberries outside the crepe. 

Not a lot of seating, and the staff is nice. But the crepe is okay, I like the crepe place in Japantown, its good.
author: Desiree T.

description:
I've never been one for sweet crepes, but instead, prefer hearty crepes stuffed with turkey, cheese, etc.  I took a glimpse at The Crepe Cafe's menu and they definitely had crepes for the sweet tooth.  Although I'm not one for the sweets, the cafe had an extensive menu of both dessert crepes and specialty crepes.

Some of the more appetizing crepes on the menu were the veggie, turkey, and turkey pesto crepes.  On the sweet side, the smores crepe sounded more than enough to satisfy any sweet tooth anyone might have.  I ordered the turkey crepe which included turkey, monterey jack, roma tomatoes, and sprouts.  

The crepes are made to order and can be viewed as there being made.  My crepe took about ten minutes to be made and looked delicious as it was being made.  Once I got my hands on it, the cheese oozed, the turkey was fresh, and the roma tomatoes and sprouts gave it a veggie crunch.  The combination of textures and flavors made for a great mid-day snack.  For about $10, you can get yourself just about any crepe on the menu and a soft drink.  A must try for those looking to get something other than fish and chips at Pier 39.
author: Alexander E.

description: Delicious, fresh strawberry and nutella crepes. My kids LOVED watching them make the crepes, and they were so tasty. I wish there was a bit more seating and it was kind of packed. Only one indoor table but we were lucky to find a table outside. There were limited seats and my husband had to sit on a crate... plus it was freezing outside! But I guess it added to the Fisherman's Wharf experience. We all loved the crepes. Wish I could have another one now...
author: F Z.

description: Small place. YOu get to watch them make the crepe which is cool. Price is about 7 or 8 dollars depending on what you get. I got the strawberry banana nutella crepe which was DELICIOUS! one of the best crepes ive ever tried. No seatings inside just a little stand. Great place for desert
author: Mimi V.

description: Every time i come to the Fisherman's Wharf, I have to come here. I remember getting the Ghirardellii crepe (milk chocolate) and It was so yummy. Everytime I come here, there's always line out the door but it's so worth the wait though. Last time I came here, I wanted to get the same Ghirardelli crepe but they only had dark chocolate so I ended up getting the strawberry crepe.  Like i said, it was so delicious. If you're going to Pier 39 anytime soon, check out this place.
author: Janice V.

description: Standard crepe place. Not too expensive. I had the ham and cheese crepe. My wife had the breakfast plus. It's cool because they make it in front of you. Worth a shot when walking around the pier. Not as special as I thought it would be. Wish I would've ordered the ghirardelli chocolate one.
author: Jared C.

description: It was awesome watching them make their crepes in the front window. We unfortunately didn't get the crepes, but just the garlic fries to go. They were great! The jalapeno ketchup had the perfect amount of flavor and spice, and the pesto mayo was smooth and zesty. It was also cool seeing them whip these up right in front of you. Definitely need to return for the crepes!
author: Meera T.

description:
Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 are places that tourists to San Francisco like myself must visit, and so my friends took me there.  One of the things I noticed in San Francisco was that there were about as many crepe places there as there are cupcakes.  It seems San Franciscans love their crepes as much as New Yorkers love their cupcakes.

I saw the Crepe Cafe in Fisherman's Wharf and at first I thought, well there are many crepe places to try.  I can just wait.  But then I saw on their menu they make a "Smores Crepe", which is a crepe with chocolate, marshmallow, and graham cracker, and I decided right away that I needed to try that.

I can't speak for the other crepes, but this one was very good.  The ingredients went well together and it was very sweet!
author: Radford T.

description:
Stopped by here on a family trip and the crepe wasn't my favorite. I like how they have a variety of crepes (sweet and savory) but maybe it was just the crepe I chose to eat that didn't taste any good. I got the Ghiradelli dark chocolate crepe and it was just TOO SWEET for my taste. I like how they ask their customers if they would like powered sugar and whipped cream right before they serve it though.
Because the crepe was supposed to be my lunch, I also got some garlic fries and boy was it amazing! I like the strong garlic flavors and it makes me feel all cozy inside my belly. Oh... and beware of stanky vampire repellent from your mouth! (:
author: Vivian K.

description: Love this place. I am not a vegetarian but almost always get the Veggie with Feta crepe. I work across the street and get a pier employee discount. The amount I go here, it adds up! Quick, inexpensive and DELICIOUS!
author: George G.

description:
For a tourist trap this place wasn't bad.  We were with a tourist who wanted crepes, so we decided to try it out.

They made their crepes fresh (huge display window out front so you can watch) and the special (fries, drink and a ham and cheese crepe for $8) hardly seemed over priced.  

The crepe was actually really tasty, but the dipping sauce I got with the fries was not one I would recommend (chiptole aoili) and since additional sauces cost $0.50 I didn't enjoy my fries as much as I otherwise would have since I was too cheap to venture worrying that I would end up with another flavor I disliked.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Let's make this easy for you.

Dulce de leche.
author: Chai S.

description: We always pass by The Crepe Café whenever we're at Pier 39 in San Francisco and the place is always packed so we never stop by.  We were there again a few weeks ago for a wedding and I finally had to try it. If it's that busy I'd assume they must have good food right?  I waited for over 15 minutes for my strawberry and banana crepe and it looked really good.  When I finally got to try it, I was really disappointed.  There was nothing special at all with my crepe so I'm still not sure with all the hype.  It tasted dry and was bland in flavor.  Unless I had a bad batch I'm not sure if I'd stop by here again.
author: Sunshine S.

description:
Love this place! Its small and in the middle of Pier 39. Usually has a long line. Me and my girlfriend had the ham and cheese combo crepe. Cost $10.50 but what meal in Pier 39 doesnt cost that much?

The crepe was AWESOME! I wanted more! But yea. The fries were made fresh, but I dont know why I didnt really like it that much. It was nice that they had different sauces to pick from!

Would definitely come here again. Prices are good too. $6 or so for a crepe. Not bad as your in Pier 39.
author: Daniel S.

description: going here for a while now, i can say that the quality went downhill.  used to be that even if there's a huge line waiting, they make sure that their crepes are made close to perfection.  nowadays, seems like they do not care.  for the last two times i ordered, crepes were burnt, very dry and at times rubbery.  sad!
author: Trisha M.

description:
Craving sweet or savory? This place will do the trick!

Crepe! Crepe! Crepes galore! I love it. Did I ever tell you I'm a big fan of crepes? Sweet, savory... you name it and I'm there! 

Everytime I'm at the pier I make sure to stop by The Crepe Cafe before leaving. I ALWAYS order the "Banana Nutella" my favorito! Who doesn't love bananas smothered in chocolate nutella spread wrapped in a warm crepe? Omg, I'm salivating just talking about it. 

The Crepe Cafe has a decent list of variations of crepes you can order. Assorments of sweet crepes and as well as savory. My savory recommendation would be the "turkey, spinach, and swiss" deelish!

The workers are nice and friendly. It's nice being able to watch them through the window while they whip up your crepes. The place is small so there isn't much room to hang around inside while waiting, but you can enjoy your crepe outside where they have a few tables. 

Enjoy your crepes!
author: Cassie D.

description: A decent crepe place hidden among the shops on the pier, this is a good place to satisfy your sugar craving. Try the neutella crepe with bananas and strawberries - loved it! A bit on the pricey side though, as most things are on the pier. I hear the garlic fries are pretty awesome too - will try those next!
author: Vivek R.

description: Dulce de leche crepe was really good. It needs more filling though, I felt like most of it was warm crepe. It was made fast,.and you can watch them make it so you know when your crepe is done.
author: Jiten P.

description: The lemon crepe was my favorite.  So tart and delicious!  It was a perfect start to exploring the area.  On my list for future visits!  Definitely a winner for crepe lovers.
author: Angela S.

description: Nothing better on a Sunday morning in San Francisco then waking up early to listen to the sea lions roar, and order a made-just-for-you delicious crepe right on the pier. Love this place!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
You're walking along Pier 39, you're a tourist and you're attracted to everything you see. The windows, the displays... How about a guy making crepes right in front of you face? Good enough to stop you from window shopping and actually get you into the store? Yup... It was good enough for me. 

The place is TINY. And it's pretty bad when you're ordering and you want a damn seat to eat your delicious looking crepes. There is outdoor seating, but its dirty and usually cold out since it's right near the water. But, besides that, the staff are nice. Much of their drinks are overpriced and the crepes are decent since they are the BEST in the world. I wouldn't mind paying for them. 

They separate their menu, dessert and lunch. The lunch crepes usually consist of chicken or some kind of protein with cheese and veggies. Comes with a side order of fries if you order a meal. I'm just not used to the fact that you can stuff meat and cheese into crepes and still call it a crepe. Crepes are meant to be for desserts. Right? 

Well I tried the chicken crepe. It was good. It wasn't horribly disgusting. It was just okay. It felt really odd to be eating cheese and chicken and a crepe. I mean it just didn't feel normal. I wouldn't order it again. I mean some people think it's normal, but I would like to stick with crepes being desserts please.

Me and my ex boyfriend always come to SF specifically for shopping and tourist attractions. We made it a tradition to always come here for the crepes. He is a big fan of crepes. We've tried them all, from tiny milk tea cafes to ones in Monterey. Nope, they just don't cut it. Here is the BEST crepes you can get. Seriously. Just cause they use the same nutella, it doesn't mean they all taste the same...

Our original consists of: nutella, strawberries and bananas. They have many fruit ones. Dessert crepes range from just plain nutella or just powdered sugar or with just fruit. You can make up something in your head and they will accommodate you. You won't be disappointed. Once you see how packed the place is and the staff making crepes in front of your face, you can't help to try it. Oh and smell sucks you right in. 

This place is a MUST try. It just ain't some tourist attraction. They literally have the BEST crepes here. You'll fall in love if you haven't had before.
author: Katie C.

description: A SF tradition. Nice morning walk. Delicious, fresh, hot creeps. Any are great, but Banana Nutella the most popular. We will be back next trip.
author: John G.

description:
I love banana crepes w/ nutella, nothing can ever keep me away from its perfect combination.

I have nothing much to say about this crepe place except holy mother of crepes! This place makes one of the best classic crepes ever! They are nothing like Genki Living crepes. They spread plenty of nutella to wipe years off your precious life. Whip cream and chocolate sauce was plentiful.One crepe was a really good size for me and my boyfriend, unless you're one of those i-don't-share-couples, you should probably get your own.
author: Victoria I.

description: There isn't really much to say other then delicious. The night before we watched them make Strawberry, Banana and Nutella Crepe's and I knew immediately what I would be having the next morning for breakfast. The smell of the freshly made crepes did not disappoint my taste buds as I finally got to devour one of these amazing creations. I wish this place was near where I live because I would certainly have become a regular if it was.
author: Drew N.

description: Tasty light snacks. Tried the veggie crepe and the florentine crepe. Liked the florentine one.
author: Darshan S.

description: Delicious crepes and a fun location (obviously a very touristy one). The manager on duty let me refill my coffee for free, which was nice. Grab some crepes and go eat them by the Bay!
author: Spencer B.

description:
I love crepes and I have tried it at a few places. Every place makes it differently but mostly on the drier and firmer side.

I was mesmerized by the aroma and watching them flipping the crepes like professional pancake flippers I had to go in and have one even I just had brunch.

The sugar #1 (with cinnamon and lots of whipped cream) was so soft and the flour was fine and light that it was so melting in my mouth.

Not a lot of space (1 sitting table and 1 standing counter) but you can sit outside enjoying this great dessert!
author: T L.

description:
yum! freshly made crepes - right at the window for you....  we shared the smores crepe.... and it was a nice snack! 

not sure how much it cost, but i mean your in the middle of tourist central, i wouldn't expect anything there to be cheap....
author: Eunice F.

description: They only had 2 staff working, so service was a slow, and it was over-priced (hello, Pier 39).  Still, all in all, I was pleased with my crepe...s'mores!  It featured Ghirardelli chocolate chips, melted mini marshmallows, and graham cracker crumbs.
author: Sam G.

description:
YUM CREPE.
So we were in SF and I Yelp'd up a great crepe place to eat and voila, CREPE CAFE came up.  I was like, sure, let's dooo it. So we went to Pier 39 and we looked around and it was kinda deep in there but it was THERE =P.  I usually order fruit crepes, but there was a "smore crepe" and I was having a sweet tooth at the moment so I was like, what the heck sure.  It was SUPER DELICIOUS (maybe 2 marshmellows over =( ) BUT STILL DELICIOUS and super sweet oh man did I thirst after.  Anyways! The next day after lunch I begged to come back to satisfy my sweet tooth & dessert craving for a crepe.  I got a nutella/strawberry crepe and boy did I love it.  I had to run from my car in the middle of the Fisherman's Wharf traffic, and jump back into my car after I picked it up.  The business is quick, and they are nice. 

Yes, I recommend this place.
author: Sarahbelle B.

description:
I am a crepe fan. Sweet or savory, bring it on.

A little about my own life: I thought crepes were just thin pancakes, or hotcakes as I knew them when I was growing up. Boy, was I wrong.

I have been to several creperies in Socal. They were good to OK. Some are great, some, not so, but all in all, good. There's a saying that compares an intimate act to pizza. I compare the same intimate act to crepes; even if it's bad, it can still be good.

Had the Ham and Cheese crepe from nice little quaint place in Fisherman's Wharf amidst all the overpriced seafood. It came with pommes frites, just another name for french fries and a drink. Boy, they don't skimp on the ham at all. It had layers and layers of it! The crepe was nice and tender, not at all overcooked and dry. 

Never tried the sweet ones, but Nutella seems to be a favored spread used for crepes. Hey, it's delicious, how could they not favor it? If you don't find the correct combo you want on either the savory or sweet side, just make your own up to four ingredients for less than 10 clams.

I love this place, I won't hesitate to go back to this place, even amidst all the other things that beg you to taste them, including chocolates, mini donuts and a place that sells a ton of salt water taffy.
author: Alex L.

description: Just OK crepes . We ordered the chicken crepe and mixed fruit Nutella crepe. We also ordered the garlic fries which were better than the crepes.
author: Aries G.

description:
My brother, an almost chef, first got me hooked on his "wonderful OMG food should not taste this good" Nutella crepe.

They are not as good as his but they are very darn close!!!

YUM......YUM...YUM
author: Virgo M.

description:
This is a MUST if you go to Pier 39. I make a point of going whenever I am in San Fran. The strawberries & nutella and the cinnamon & sugar are my favorites.

The Crepe Cafe is privately owned and very well run. You can tell the owner takes care of his staff, because the 3 main guys I see every time I go there have been since I moved to CA 7 years ago. That says something.

Depending on the day you may have to wait in line, but just be patient because it is well worth the wait when you get that warm crepe:)
author: Tonya R.

description: $7.50 a crepe and it's worth it!  But if you want to save your dolars, go to the one in Japantown.  It was under $5.
author: Cathaleya C.

description:
Best pomme frites in San Francisco, hands down.

I was freezing my ass off at Pier 39 today and needed something warm to put me right.

Thankfully, my eyes found The Crepe Cafe and I saw their photo on the wall of a funnel of hot, crispy frites.

I ordered a breakfast crepe and coffee to complement my Freedom Fries and had to say that the pomme frites were the star of the show.

The crepe was alright, definitely the late-night street vendor variety and not sit-down-restaurant or Breton-style, but it's definitely good enough for the Pier.

Sadly the coffee was Starbucks, but it was hot, and on a chilly day, I'll partake in Satan's Favorite Brew.

Anyways, come here for the best fries in San Francisco, vouched for by a bona fide French Fry Snob who won't shut up about how American food and especially California Pizza and Californified Sushi sucks balls and how much better the food is in France and NYC.

Enjoy! :)
author: Justin C.

description: Well vacationing in Frisco ordered a turkey pesto crepe and got food posioning from this place!!!!! Throwing up outta both ends all night!!!!!
author: Pappa P.

description: Always come here for good crepes everytime i visit pier 39.
author: SK L.

description: On Aug 17, 2014, we came for breakfast at 9:15am and the staff told us that they were still closed.   I pointed out that in their hours, it has 9am as opening time, they just said they are not yet ready and to wait 10 more minutes.   We moved on to eat at another place nearby.   Business, LOST.
author: Jennifer S.

description: not only completey intoxicating but what an entertaining show just watching them prepare them through the window. I had never actually tried a crepe before but after watching them for a minute I had to try them. I ordered it with strawberry and damn it was good on such a chilly day by the bay.
author: Scott D.

description:
Don't ask why I was perusing this tourist trap.  What?  Ok.  Fine.
My boyfriend really wanted to see Ripley's Believe It Or Not, and, as always, I was hungry.  So before entering the "museum," I opted for a crepe from Pier 39.  
Perhaps if I didn't work for a living and instead sat on pillows stuffed with baby hair and ate gold-plated caviar, this place would not have seemed so expensive.  Alas, $8 for a very thin pancake and some Nutella is hardly worth it.  Nevertheless, I was hungry (as I mentioned) and nothing gets in my way when I'm hungry, so I ordered the poorly thought out investment.
Pretty good.  Not perfect, as in, not as good as those you get in the streets of Paris for a fraction of the cost (even when converted to Euros).  
Further lowering the star count: the employees and the line of drooling, oogling tourists.
author: Christine M.

description:
It's really not their fault so here's a little tip from me to you:

My order: Hot Chocolate + Nutella Crepe 

My thought after eating: Chocolate Overload. Too much chocolate. I think I may be sick.


Other observations - this place gets really busy and you have to wait a bit for your order and it all seems at bit disorganized. Still, listening to blasting rock music on the pier while eating a crepe is a pretty darn good experience.
author: Beth F.

description: We had the dulce de leche crepe. IT was amazing. The also put whip cream and powdered sugar on top. YUMMMM. The only reason I gave it 4 star instead of 5 is because of the price. Came out to almost 10 bucks for 1 CREPE.
author: Jaselle G.

description: Delectable freshly made to order crepes. My favorite is the Banana Nutella! A must visit, every time I'm in the area.
author: Nom Nom T.

description:
The Crepe Cafe is actually a decent place to get a non-seafood oriented meal while at Fisherman's Wharf.  The place can get pretty packed with tourists looking for a quick snack- unfortunately, there's nothing quick about the place once orders start rolling in.  It took a good 20 minutes for me to get my simple banana and Nutella crepe, even with all 4 crepe stations going at once.

3 stars for an okay crepe- there was plenty of Nutella, but at almost $8 a crepe, you would think they could afford to be a little more generous with the banana.  The crepe was not as crisp as I like it to be, plus it was annoying to have to shove back to the front and ask for the whipped cream that was supposed to have been on my crepe.
author: Angela H.

description: Fast, good and just right after dinner.  I had the simple raspberry jam and cream cheese crepe.  Price was fine. Everything on pier 39 is pricey but expected.
author: Bret H.

description:
Sacre bleu!  Ze crepes at ze Crepe Café are fantastique!!  It is like a little trip to Paris without the jetlag.

Crepes stuffed with your favorites... ham & cheese or banana & nutella... what's not to love?  Warm, filling and delicious.  A great addition to Pier 39.  Reasonable prices considering the locale and the view.  The people watching is free!

The place can get busy (that's a GOOD sign) but the smells are wonderful and watching them make the crepes is fun too.

Go here, eat and say "oh la la" with me.....
author: Paul S.

description: Had the breakfast crêpe with turkey and it was amazing! The turkey they used tasted like it was carved fresh and the crêpe itself was cooked perfect. Service was fast so no complaints there. Would definitely recommend.
author: Blain M.

description:
Everytime we are in SF we have a crepe on the wharf. 

The sweet ones are ok...but the real jewel here is the turkey pesto....
Normally i would say hold the avacado but not this time, it is an amazing addition. 

Fun place to eat :)
author: Tiffany M.

description: We stopped in for a snack and shared a large order of garlic fries. I prefer shoestring fries ....these were the thick cuts so they weren't as crunchy as I would have liked.  There was also too much garlic...the straight out of the jar kind so no, it was not the good stuff lol. I wasn't satisfied in the end lol.
author: MissusBugatti J.

description: WOW! Absolutely delicious!! I Ordered a dessert crepe with ghiradeli milk chocolate and strawberries (no whip cream) and it was insanely delicious!! So chocolatey and amazing.  It was a tiny bit overpriced, but a must try if you are anywhere around fisherman's wharf!
author: Hailee G.

description:
Bland...

and way too expensive.
$8.00 for the strawberry / banana crepe.
Used the same tortilla as a carne asada burrito.
Lacked any sweet flavor even though it had whipped cream and powdered sugar on top.
Don't get fooled and lured in by the chefs in the window making the crepes.
author: Realtor Karl B.

description:
Richard Pro here with another review. I've had crepes all over and this place is one of the best. 

I always get the chocolate and strawberry crepe wherever i go. For about 8 bucks here, that's not a bad deal. Crepes here are generously large and two layers, which I appreciate. It's filled with slices of strawberries and has a little too much chocolate...but every single chocolate crepe i've ever had always had too much chocolate. 

For a tourist place, prices and portion size are very fair. Stuff like this can cost up to 12 bucks at a tourist location.

Interior is nothing to boast about. Service is fine but not exceptional. I enjoy getting a crepe and then walking down to the end of the pier.

5 stars because of all the crepe places i've been to, this place has the largest crepes by far, and pricing is fair. A Mexican guy makes this French treat, but he is amazing and knows what he is doing. He's been working there for at least the past three years i've been there. 

If you are a crepe expert by any means you will know these crepes are authentic and larger than anywhere else.
author: Richard P.

description:
ah yes...the famous crepe store of pier 39.
so let's see...i'm ot exactly a tourist TOURIST person because i live in san jose and i always go to san francisco. and everytime i go to fisherman's wharf i HAVE to stop by this store and grab a crepe.
fresh and perfectly made in front of you. friendly staff (most of the time)
their fries are a guilty pleasure too...haha
however the last time i went, there were a couple guys on staff...and i didn't really like them. they weren't as chipper or engaged in conversation like other staff i've encountered. the guy cooking up the crepes barely put any nutella in the crepes.
but that was just one time...the staff is usually great and highly skilled and quick.
author: Lanie L.

description:
I'll go out of my way to leave a good review for a decent crepe place where you'd least expect it (i.e. the tourist trap that is Fisherman's Wharf). Not memorable, but not overly expensive, and did the trick of quenching a rare crepes craving of mine.

It gets busy, and they're ill-equipped to handle business it seems. Place turns chaotic, but don't worry, just stand outside waiting and looking at your crepe being made and then go claim it yourself.
author: Alexander G.

description: Expensive for what I think of as street food.  It was very tasty though.  I got the Nutella because you can't go wrong with Nutella.  I was glad I got it.
author: Michael C.

description:
Oh this place is AWESOME. I had no idea crepe's can be so yummy, even  on a full stomach. I wasn't going to eat any, and for 4 of us I recommended only 1 which didn't go well with my friend. And after having a fourth, I realized why :-)

The only bad thing is that when it's cold, there's not much space to sit and eat, but who care when it's so delicious. This is definitely going to be a regular stop on our every Pier 39 trip.
author: Mayank R.

description: Had a savory ham & cheese crepe...and fries...what a great combo & a great meal! I was very happy with it, as it was my first savory crepe. Next time I'm back in town, I will definitely come back!
author: Dee N.

description:
If you like crepes, this place is worth checking out when you are in San Francisco and on the pier.  It costs $6-8 per crepe.  My friend and I split a Ghiradelli Milk Chocolate Crepe with whipped cream.  It's rich, based on the Ghiradelli chocolate.  It's nice to see them make it in front of your very eyes.  I've been to others where they don't let you watch which to me is weird.  Half of the fun is watching your food being made! 

Prompt with service, good crepes.  My only complaint is that it's a bit pricey, but otherwise pretty good.
author: Tony T.

description: I have always watched these guys make Crepe's when I am at the Pier, but I never felt like going inside as it is always crowded and they just have 3 tables inside and have table outside that are always occupied! I was lucky this weekend to find an empty table inside the restaurant, tried the regular sugar crepe with cinnamon, it was simply delicioso. I will go back if it is not crowded.
author: Nirmal S.

description: I was a little skeptical because it seems as though every little thing in Fisherman's Wharf is way more expensive than it should be, but I paid about $8.50 for a good sized crepe with strawberries, nutella, whipped cream and powdered sugar. Not the best crepe I've ever had, but surprisingly really good and filling -perfect to split between two people.
author: Katherine M.

description: As a Pier 39 employee, I have tried all of the crepes especially the strawberry, banana, nutella, with rum. You should try the breakfast crepe egg and cheese.
author: Steven C.

description: All I can say is get the Banana & Nutella crepe...YUMMY! And the hubbie liked it as well, since he's not much into these at all. Just thinking about it is making me drool =) ....a must when you go to Pier 39. The strawberry crepe looked good too since you can see how they make them, a must try on our next visit.
author: Lili Phuong C.

description: Pleasantly surprised.  My son wanted to give it a try.  It was so good we got back ont he line and got a second one.  yum.
author: L K.

description:
I ran into this place when I was wandering around Pier 39. I stopped in for lunch and decided to try my first crepe. I believe I ordered the turkey pesto crepe and it was delicious! I shared an order of frites with my boyfriend which were tasty as well. The frites come with one dipping sauce of your choice. They offer a couple of different sauces which all looked good. 

I would like to go back and try a dessert crepe. 

The workers can be quite entertaining to watch when they are making crepes as well.
author: Carly W.

description: Overpriced. Not impressed. Maybe the sweet dessert crepes were the way to go.
author: Chauanh D.

description: Had three cappucinos and a crepe with the ghirardelli dark chocolate.  Was happy to have the awesome crepe after a long long time...
author: J S.

description: I don't normally cave to the sights and smells of food on the pier, but I couldn't fight off the crepes here. I crumbled like a small child. I had the turkey pesto crepe and it was amazing! The hardest thing here is picking which delicious crepe you want- sweet or savory. One of the specials was a smores crepe, oh yes, you read that right. It was ghirardelli chocolate chips, marshmallows and graham cracker crumbs. If only I had a bigger stomach I would have eaten my way through the menu. I'll be back in a heartbeat. YUMMY! The seating is a bit lacking, but there are tables and benches all over the pier.
author: Stephanie B.

description: Awesome spot.  Had the Strawberries and Chocolate Crepe.  Very good.   I went here with a friend and we probably could've had another one.  Will definitely be coming back here!
author: reggie b.

description: I was so very happy to have a crepe while watching the sea lions. Sadly this place is horrible. I will never go back and will never recommend this place to any one. Dont let their window fool you like they did to me. Its awesome to watch them cook them right in front of you, but its not worth the prize or line or dry crepes. There are better locations in other parts of San Francisco, this one is over rated. Even the one Universal City Walk is equally as horrible and over priced. Avoid this place if you can.
author: lesly l.

description: Love my crepes!!!! MMMMM the ham and cheese is my favorite! The dessert ones are yummy too! This place is a little pricey so I don't get them every time I'm in the area but would love it if I could!!
author: Stephanie M.

description: I LOVE this crepe cafe . The crepes are pretty good .. they're not crunchy but not soggy either . The savory crepes are wonderful .. WONDERFUL I TELL YA !! I've tried the chicken crepe and the ham & cheese crepe which were both really really yummy and flavorful ! However , I think I like the ham & cheese crepe more . Both crepes were FILLED - they were stuffed . I thought the people were pretty generous because there's a lot of other crepe places that put very little in their savory crepes . The fries were pretty good too . The creamy chipotole sauce isn't all that great but i LOVE the jalapeno ketchup .. it's delish and oh so addicting !! Only bad thing about this place is that there are barely any tables to sit and eat !! Anyways , I still need to try their dessert crepes ..
author: Eileen L.

description: Top notch crepes and toppings. I've had crepes all over the world, and this place is one of the best. The entire staff is courteous and professional. I load up on these things whenever I'm in San Francisco. Eat here, people. You'll thank me.
author: Philly D.

description: Crepe is always my favorite thing.  Whenever I go to Pier 39, I must grab a #11 here.  It's TOTALLY AwESoMe!!!!!  Don't forget to add banana.  (got that recommendation by the lady there!)  Awwww...... I want another N.O.W!!!!!  (glad I worked out tonight, haha.)
author: Jacky L.

description: In spite of my  self, I actually really like this place. I wish it didn't cost $12++ for a combo meal, but it's great for a splurge once in a while. Their veggie crepe is SO delicious! Avocado, cheese, tomatoes, sprouts, yum!! The workers here are really great, and I come here sometimes for their Starbucks-brewed coffee, which really hits the spot. They also make french fries, and they let you choose your dipping sauce! I recommend the pesto mayo.
author: Bridgette A.

description: They make delicious crepes here! I really like the the strawberry with ghiradelli chocolate and whip. I do not remember what number that is on the menu, but it was really good. You can even watch them as they make it. It is so worth every penny.
author: Veronika P.

description: I thought this place was YUMMY!  I had their crepe with nutella and strawberries....it was huge and pretty tasty.  They have a huge window that people gather around and watch them hook it up.  It was pretty busy but again there are tons of tourist so most of the places in Pier 39 are like that.
author: Natacha M.

description: Love this place. Shared the crepe with strawberries, bananas, and nutella. Simply irresistible!
author: Diana P.

description: I completely and abso-flippin-lutely love the nutella-banana-strawberry crepes that they serve here. And the fact that you get to see them actually make them adds to the experience. The only complaint is that they do not really have a wide variety of crepes but that's understandable considering their size. I highly recommend this place for a nice eat on your day out in san francisco.
author: P S.
